    <article class="post hentry" id="1154193554250075360" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> 0d1n - Tool For Automating Customized Attacks Against Web Applications  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-1154193554250075360" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-bUcYnPL1m9M/Vltir5IQB5I/AAAAAAAAE20/T9eBUr4LM24/s1600/0d1n.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="368" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-bUcYnPL1m9M/Vltir5IQB5I/AAAAAAAAE20/T9eBUr4LM24/s640/0d1n.png" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> Web security tool to make fuzzing at HTTP inputs, made in C with libCurl.
      <br> 
      <a name="more"></a>
      <br> 
      <b><span style="font-size: large;">You can do:</span></b>
      <br> 
      <ul> 
       <li>brute force passwords in auth forms</li> 
       <li>directory disclosure ( use PATH list to brute, and find HTTP status code )</li> 
       <li>test list on input to find SQL Injection and XSS vulnerabilities</li> 
      </ul> 
      <br> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Enzs37UYv8w/VltjagimTBI/AAAAAAAAE28/3lIhAElISlw/s1600/0d1n_2.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="492" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Enzs37UYv8w/VltjagimTBI/AAAAAAAAE28/3lIhAElISlw/s640/0d1n_2.png" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <b><span style="font-size: large;">To run:</span></b>
      <br> 
      <br> require libcurl-dev or libcurl-devel(on rpm linux based)
      <br> 
      <pre><code>$ git clone https://github.com/CoolerVoid/0d1n/</code></pre> need libcurl to run
      <br> 
      <pre><code>$ sudo apt-get install libcurl-dev</code></pre> if rpm distro
      <br> 
      <pre><code>$ sudo yum install libcurl-devel
$ make
$./0d1n</code></pre> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: center;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: x-large;"><a href="https://github.com/CoolerVoid/0d1n" target="_blank">Download&nbsp;0d1n</a></span></b>
      </div> 
     </div>
    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="6140070109741739526" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> 3vilTwinAttacker - Create Rogue Wi-Fi Access Point and Snooping on the Traffic  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-6140070109741739526" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
      </div> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Ku3RCc9AAig/VQyMrfw7qxI/AAAAAAAAD0Y/lkk5zUNc7mE/s1600/3vilTwinAttacker.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Ku3RCc9AAig/VQyMrfw7qxI/AAAAAAAAD0Y/lkk5zUNc7mE/s1600/3vilTwinAttacker.png" height="460" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        This tool create an rogue Wi-Fi access point , purporting to provide wireless Internet services, but snooping on the traffic.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <b><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: large;">Software dependencies:</span></b>
      </div> 
      <ul class="task-list"> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Recommended to use Kali linux.</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Ettercap.</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Sslstrip.</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Airbase-ng include in aircrack-ng.</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">DHCP.</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Nmap.</li> 
      </ul> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
      </div> 
      <a name="more"></a>
      <br> 
      <b><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: large;">Install DHCP in Debian-based</span></b>
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-weight: normal;"><b>Ubuntu</b></span> 
      <br> 
      <pre><code>$ sudo apt-get install isc-dhcp-server</code></pre> 
      <br> 
      <b>Kali linux</b>
      <br> 
      <pre><code>$ echo "deb http://ftp.de.debian.org/debian wheezy main " &gt;&gt; /etc/apt/sources.list
$ apt-get update &amp;&amp; apt-get install isc-dhcp-server</code></pre> 
      <br> 
      <b><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: large;">Install DHCP in redhat-based</span></b>
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <b>Fedora</b>
      <br> 
      <pre><code>$ sudo yum install dhcp</code></pre> 
      <br> 
      <b><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: large;">Tools Options:</span></b>
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-h_a7PyZ6pzo/VQyOGWMcFvI/AAAAAAAAD0k/xk2PBGmKtx8/s1600/3vilTwinAttacker02.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-h_a7PyZ6pzo/VQyOGWMcFvI/AAAAAAAAD0k/xk2PBGmKtx8/s1600/3vilTwinAttacker02.png"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong>Etter.dns:</strong> Edit etter.dns to loading module dns spoof.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong>Dns Spoof:</strong> Start dns spoof attack in interface ath0 fake AP.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong>Ettercap:</strong> Start ettercap attack in host connected AP fake Capturing login credentials.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong>Sslstrip:</strong> The sslstrip listen the traffic on port 10000.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong>Driftnet:</strong> The driftnet sniffs and decodes any JPEG TCP sessions, then displays in an window.
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-7Kajrv6hR4M/VQyOeFtKZ5I/AAAAAAAAD0s/h59OPYxK5xw/s1600/3vilTwinAttacker03.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-7Kajrv6hR4M/VQyOeFtKZ5I/AAAAAAAAD0s/h59OPYxK5xw/s1600/3vilTwinAttacker03.png"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong>Deauth Attack:</strong> kill all devices connected in AP (wireless network) or the attacker can Also put the Mac-address in the Client field, Then only one client disconnects the access point.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong>Probe Request:</strong> Probe request capture the clients trying to connect to AP,Probe requests can be sent by anyone with a legitimate Media Access Control (MAC) address, as association to the network is not required at this stage.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong>Mac Changer:</strong> you can now easily spoof the MAC address. With a few clicks, users will be able to change their MAC addresses.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong>Device FingerPrint:</strong> list devices connected the network mini fingerprint, is information collected about a local computing device.
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <b><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: large;">Video Demo </span></b>
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <center> 
       <iframe allowfullscreen frameborder="0" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Jrb43KVPIJw" width="560"></iframe>
      </center> 
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: center;"> 
       <b><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: x-large;"><a href="https://github.com/P0cL4bs/3vilTwinAttacker" target="_blank">Download 3vilTwinAttacker</a></span></b>
      </div> 
     </div>
    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="5106196332520810097" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> Acunetix clamps down on costly website security with online solution  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-5106196332520810097" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="normal"> 
       <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
        <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
         <a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-lEttXa0pPsQ/VPeIH6kGS3I/AAAAAAAADvY/lku_tSGbMdY/s1600/acunetix.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-lEttXa0pPsQ/VPeIH6kGS3I/AAAAAAAADvY/lku_tSGbMdY/s1600/acunetix.jpg" height="308" width="640"></a>
        </div> 
        <i><br></i> 
        <i><span>2nd March 2015 - London, UK</span></i>
        <span> - As cyber security continues to hit the headlines, even smaller companies can expect to be subject to scrutiny and therefore securing their website is more important than ever. In response to this, Acunetix are offering the online edition of their vulnerability scanner at a new lower entry price. This new option allows consumers to opt for the ability to scan just one target or website and is a further step in making the top of the range scanner accessible to a wider market.</span>
        <br> 
        <a name="more"></a>
        <span> </span>
       </div> 
      </div> 
      <div class="normal"> 
       <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
        <br> A web vulnerability scanner allows the user to identify any weaknesses in their website architecture which might aid a hacker. They are then given the full details of the problem in order to fix it. While the scanner might previously have been a niche product used by penetration testers, security experts and large corporations, in our current cyber security climate, such products need to be made available to a wider market. Acunetix have recognised this which is why both the product and its pricing have become more flexible and tailored to multiple types of user, with a one scan target option now available at $345. Pricing for other options has also been reduced by around 15% to reflect the current strength of the dollar. Use of the network scanning element of the product is also currently being offered completely free.
       </div> 
      </div> 
      <div class="normal"> 
       <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
        <br>
       </div> 
      </div> 
      <div class="normal"> 
       <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
        <span>Acunetix CEO Nicholas Galea said:<i> ‘Due to recent attacks such as the Sony hack and the Anthem Inc breach, companies are under increasing pressure to ensure their websites and networks are secure. We’ve been continuously developing our vulnerability scanner for a decade now, it’s a pioneer in the field and continues to be the tool of choice for many security experts. We feel it’s a tool which can benefit a far wider market which is why we developed the more flexible and affordable online version.’</i></span>
       </div> 
       <br> 
       <div class="normal" style="text-align: justify;"> 
        <b><span><span style="font-size: large;">About Acunetix Vulnerability Scanner (Online version)</span></span></b>
        <span></span>
       </div> 
       <div class="normal" style="text-align: justify;"> 
        <b><span><br></span></b>
       </div> 
       <div class="normal" style="text-align: justify;"> 
        <span>User-friendly and competitively priced, Acunetix Vulnerability Scanner fully interprets and scans websites, including HTML5 and JavaScript and detects a large number of vulnerabilities, including </span>
        <span><b>SQL Injection</b></span>
        <span> and </span>
        <span><b>Cross Site Scripting</b></span>
        <span>, eliminating false positives. <span>Acunetix beats competing products in many areas; including speed, the strongest support of modern technologies such as JavaScript, the lowest number of false positives and the ability to access restricted areas with ease. Acunetix also has the most advanced detection of WordPress vulnerabilities and a wide range of reports including HIPAA and PCI compliance.</span></span>
       </div> 
       <div class="normal" style="text-align: justify;"> 
        <br>
       </div> 
       <div class="normal" style="text-align: justify;"> 
        <span>Users can sign up for a trial of the online version of Acunetix which includes the option to run </span>
        <a href="http://www.acunetix.com/free-network-security/?utm_source=hacktools&amp;utm_medium=banner&amp;utm_term=smaug&amp;utm_campaign=hacktools" target="_blank"><span><b>free network scans</b></span></a>
        <span>.<span>&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span>
        <span></span>
       </div> 
      </div> 
     </div>
    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="1731456868047993498" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> Acunetix Online Vulnerability Scanner  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-1731456868047993498" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="post_body"> 
       <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
        <a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ZI5KzBw-jGk/VKvZLSYqdGI/AAAAAAAADgs/W-83-vUK46I/s1600/Acunetix_logo.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ZI5KzBw-jGk/VKvZLSYqdGI/AAAAAAAADgs/W-83-vUK46I/s1600/Acunetix_logo.png" height="100" width="640"></a>
       </div> 
       <br> 
       <div style="text-align: justify;">
         Acunetix Online Vulnerability Scanner acts as a virtual security officer for your company, scanning your websites, including integrated web applications, web servers and any additional perimeter servers for vulnerabilities. And allowing you to fix them before hackers exploit the weak points in your IT infrastructure!
       </div> 
       <a name="more"></a>
       <br> 
       <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
        <b><span style="font-size: large;">Leverages Acunetix leading web application scanner</span></b>
       </div> 
       <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
        <br>
       </div> 
       <div style="text-align: justify;">
         Building on Acunetix’ advanced web scanning technology, Acunetix OVS scans your website for vulnerabilities – without requiring to you to license, install and operate Acunetix Web Vulnerability scanner. Acunetix OVS will deep scan your website – with its legendary crawling capability – including full HTML 5 support, and its unmatched SQL injection and Cross Site Scripting finding capabilities.
       </div> 
       <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
        <br>
       </div> 
       <div style="text-align: justify;">
         Unlike other online security scanners, Acunetix is able to find a much greater number of vulnerabilities because of its intelligent analysis engine – it can even detect&nbsp;
        <a href="http://www.acunetix.com/blog/web-security-zone/articles/dom-xss-explained/" target="_blank" title="DOM-XSS Explained">DOM Cross-Site Scripting</a>&nbsp;and Blind&nbsp;
        <a href="http://www.acunetix.com/websitesecurity/sql-injection/" target="_blank" title="SQL Injection Explained">SQL Injection</a>&nbsp;vulnerabilities. And with a minimum of false positives. Remember that in the world of web scanning its not the number of different vulnerabilities that it can find, its the depth with which it can check for vulnerabilities. Each scanner can find one or more SQL injection vulnerabilities, but few can find ALMOST ALL. Few scanners are able to find all pages and analyze all content, leaving large parts of your website unchecked. Acunetix will crawl the largest number of pages and analyze all content.
       </div> 
       <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
        <br>
       </div> 
       <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
        <b><span style="font-size: large;">Utilizes OpenVAS for cutting edge network security scanning</span></b>
       </div> 
       <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
        <br>
       </div> 
       <div style="text-align: justify;">
         And Acunetix OVS does not stop at web vulnerabilities. Recognizing the need to scan at network level and wanting to offer best of breed technology only, Acunetix has partnered with OpenVAS – the leading network security scanner.&nbsp;
        <a href="http://www.openvas.org/">OpenVAS&nbsp;</a>has been in development for more then 10 years and is backed by renowned security developers Greenbone. OpenVAS draws on a vulnerability database of thousands of network level vulnerabilities. Importantly, OpenVAS vulnerability databases are always up to date, boasting an average response rate of less than 24 hours for updating and deploying vulnerability signatures to scanners.
       </div> 
       <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
        <br>
       </div> 
       <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
        <b><span style="font-size: large;">Start your scan today</span></b>
       </div> 
       <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
        <br>
       </div> 
       <div style="text-align: justify;">
         Getting Acunetix on your side is easy – sign up in minutes, install the site verification code and your scan will commence. Scanning can take several hours, depending on the amount of pages and the complexity of the content. After completion, scan reports are emailed to you – and Acunetix Security Consultants are on standby to explain the results and help you action remediation. For a limited time period, 2 full Network Scans are included for FREE in the 14-day trial.&nbsp;
       </div> 
       <br> 
       <br> 
       <div style="text-align: center;"> 
        <a href="http://www.acunetix.com/free-network-security-scan/" target="_blank"><b><span style="font-size: x-large;">Acunetix Online Vulnerability Scanner</span></b></a>
       </div> 
      </div> 
     </div>
    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="94011504333092709" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> Acunetix v10 - Web Application Security Testing Tool  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-94011504333092709" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-WYobSSg-MGw/VYrwbv_LDxI/AAAAAAAAERA/1JYyHozOkS4/s1600/acunetix_10.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="202" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-WYobSSg-MGw/VYrwbv_LDxI/AAAAAAAAERA/1JYyHozOkS4/s640/acunetix_10.jpg" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Acunetix, the pioneer in automated web application security software, has announced the release of version 10 of its Vulnerability Scanner. New features are designed to prevent the risk of hacking for all customers; from small businesses up to large enterprises, including WordPress users, web application developers and pen testers.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        With the number of cyber-attacks drastically up in the last year and the cost of breaches doubling, never has limiting this risk been such a high priority and a cost-effective investment. The 2015 Information Security Breaches Survey from PWC found 90% of large organisations had suffered a breach and average costs have escalated to over £3m per breach, at the higher end.
       <br> 
       <a name="more"></a>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        The areas of a website which are most likely to be attacked and are prone to vulnerabilities are those areas that require a user to login. Therefore the latest version of Acunetix vastly improves on its ‘Login Sequence Recorder’ which can now navigate multi-step authenticated areas automatically and with ease. It crawls at lightning speed with its ‘DeepScan’ crawling engine now analyzing web applications developed using both Java Frameworks and Ruby on Rails. Version 10 also improves the automated scanning of RESTful and SOAP-based web services and can now detect over 1200 vulnerabilities in WordPress core and plugins.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: large;">Automated scanning of restricted areas</span></b>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Latest automation functionality makes Acunetix not only even easier to use, but gives better peace of mind through ensuring the entire website is scanned. Restricted areas, especially user login pages, make it more difficult for a scanner to access and often required manual intervention. The Acunetix “Login Sequence Recorder” overcomes this, having been significantly improved to allow restricted areas to be scanned completely automatically. This includes the ability to scan web applications that use Single Sign-On (SSO) and OAuth-based authentication. With the recorder following user actions rather than HTTP requests, it drastically improves support for anti-CSRF tokens, nonces or other one-time tokens, which are often used in restricted areas.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: large;">Top dog in WordPress vulnerability detection</span></b>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        With WordPress sites having exceeded 74 million in number, a single vulnerability found in the WordPress core, or even in a plugin, can be used to attack millions of individual sites. The flexibility of being able to use externally developed plugins leads to the development of even more vulnerabilities. Acunetix v10 now tests for over 1200 WordPress-specific vulnerabilities, based on the most frequently downloaded plugins, while still retaining the ability to detect vulnerabilities in custom built plugins. No other scanner on the market can detect as many WordPress vulnerabilities.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: large;">Support for various development architectures and web services</span></b>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Many enterprise-grade, mission critical applications are built using Java Frameworks and Ruby on Rails. Version 10 has been engineered to accurately crawl and scan web applications built using these technologies. With the increase in HTML5 Single Page Applications and mobile applications, web services have become a significant attack vector. The new version improves support &nbsp;for SOAP-based web services with WSDL and WCF descriptions as well as automated scanning of RESTful web services using WADL definitions. Furthermore, version 10, introduces dynamic crawl pre-seeding by integrating with external, third-party tools including Fiddler, Burp Suite and the Selenium IDE to enhance Business Logic Testing and the workflow between Manual Testing and Automation.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: large;">Detection of Malware and Phishing URLs</span></b>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Acunetix WVS 10 will ship with a malware URL detection service, which is used to analyse all the external links found during a scan against a constantly updated database of Malware and Phishing URLs. The Malware Detection Service makes use of the Google and Yandex Safe Browsing Database.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: large;">New in Acunetix Vulnerability Scanner v10</span></b>
      </div> 
      <ul> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">'Login Sequence Recorder' has been re-engineered from the ground-up to allow restricted areas to be scanned entirely automatically.</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Now tests for over 1200 WordPress-specific vulnerabilities in the WordPress core and plugins.</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Acunetix WVS Crawl data can be augmented using the output of: Fiddler .saz files, Burp Suite saved items, Burp Suite state files, HTTP Archive (.har) files, Acunetix HTTP Sniffer logs, Selenium IDE Scripts.</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Improved support for Java Frameworks (Java Server Faces [JSF], Spring and Struts) and Ruby on Rails.</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Increased web services support for web applications which make use of WSDL based web-services, Microsoft WCF-based web services and RESTful web services.</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Ships with a malware URL detection service, which is used to analyse all the external links found during a scan against a constantly updated database of Malware and Phishing URLs.</li> 
      </ul> 
      <div> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: center;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: x-large;"><a href="http://www.acunetix.com/vulnerability-scanner/download/?utm_source=hacktools&amp;utm_campaign=hacktools" target="_blank">Download&nbsp;Acunetix Web Vulnerability Scanner Version 10</a></span></b>
      </div> 
     </div>
    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="8145022764468477690" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> Aircrack-ng 1.2 RC 2 - WEP and WPA-PSK keys cracking program  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-8145022764468477690" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-0_5Y9BTcNyY/VSxKMkbERKI/AAAAAAAAD30/AXZiPam6AsI/s1600/aircrack.gif" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-0_5Y9BTcNyY/VSxKMkbERKI/AAAAAAAAD30/AXZiPam6AsI/s1600/aircrack.gif" height="350" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Here is the second release candidate. Along with a LOT of fixes, it improves the support for the Airodump-ng scan visualizer. Airmon-zc is mature and is now renamed to Airmon-ng. Also, Airtun-ng is now able to encrypt and decrypt WPA on top of WEP. Another big change is recent version of GPSd now work very well with Airodump-ng.
      </div> 
      <a name="more"></a>
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Aircrack-ng is an 802.11 WEP and WPA-PSK keys cracking program that can recover keys once enough data packets have been captured. It implements the standard FMS attack along with some optimizations like KoreK attacks, as well as the all-new PTW attack, thus making the attack much faster compared to other WEP cracking tools. In fact, Aircrack-ng is a set of tools for auditing wireless networks.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        &nbsp;Aircrack-ng is the next generation of aircrack with lots of new features: 
      </div> 
      <ul> 
       <li class="level1">
        <div class="li"> 
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Better documentation (wiki, manpages) and support (
          <a class="urlextern" href="http://forum.aircrack-ng.org/" rel="nofollow" title="http://forum.aircrack-ng.org">Forum</a>, 
          <a class="urlextern" href="http://trac.aircrack-ng.org/" rel="nofollow" title="http://trac.aircrack-ng.org">trac</a>, 
          <a class="urlextern" href="irc://irc.freenode.net/aircrack-ng" rel="nofollow" title="irc://irc.freenode.net/aircrack-ng">IRC: #aircrack-ng on Freenode</a>).
         </div> 
        </div> </li> 
       <li class="level1">
        <div class="li"> 
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           More cards/drivers supported
         </div> 
        </div> </li> 
       <li class="level1">
        <div class="li"> 
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           More 
          <abbr title="Operating System">OS</abbr> and platforms supported
         </div> 
        </div> </li> 
       <li class="level1">
        <div class="li"> 
         <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
          <a class="urlextern" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110610115301/http://www.cdc.informatik.tu-darmstadt.de/aircrack-ptw/" rel="nofollow" title="https://web.archive.org/web/20110610115301/http://www.cdc.informatik.tu-darmstadt.de/aircrack-ptw/">PTW</a> attack
         </div> 
        </div> </li> 
       <li class="level1">
        <div class="li"> 
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           WEP dictionary attack
         </div> 
        </div> </li> 
       <li class="level1">
        <div class="li"> 
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Fragmentation attack
         </div> 
        </div> </li> 
       <li class="level1">
        <div class="li"> 
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           WPA Migration mode
         </div> 
        </div> </li> 
       <li class="level1">
        <div class="li"> 
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Improved cracking speed
         </div> 
        </div> </li> 
       <li class="level1">
        <div class="li"> 
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Capture with multiple cards
         </div> 
        </div> </li> 
       <li class="level1">
        <div class="li"> 
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           New tools: 
          <a class="wikilink1" href="http://www.aircrack-ng.org/doku.php?id=airtun-ng&amp;DokuWiki=a963867ed97ec90b223f20934eb891e8" title="airtun-ng">airtun-ng</a>, 
          <a class="wikilink1" href="http://www.aircrack-ng.org/doku.php?id=packetforge-ng&amp;DokuWiki=a963867ed97ec90b223f20934eb891e8" title="packetforge-ng">packetforge-ng</a> (improved arpforge), 
          <a class="wikilink1" href="http://www.aircrack-ng.org/doku.php?id=wesside-ng&amp;DokuWiki=a963867ed97ec90b223f20934eb891e8" title="wesside-ng">wesside-ng</a>, 
          <a class="wikilink1" href="http://www.aircrack-ng.org/doku.php?id=easside-ng&amp;DokuWiki=a963867ed97ec90b223f20934eb891e8" title="easside-ng">easside-ng</a>, 
          <a class="wikilink1" href="http://www.aircrack-ng.org/doku.php?id=airserv-ng&amp;DokuWiki=a963867ed97ec90b223f20934eb891e8" title="airserv-ng">airserv-ng</a>, 
          <a class="wikilink1" href="http://www.aircrack-ng.org/doku.php?id=airolib-ng&amp;DokuWiki=a963867ed97ec90b223f20934eb891e8" title="airolib-ng">airolib-ng</a>, 
          <a class="wikilink1" href="http://www.aircrack-ng.org/doku.php?id=airdriver-ng&amp;DokuWiki=a963867ed97ec90b223f20934eb891e8" title="airdriver-ng">airdriver-ng</a>, 
          <a class="wikilink1" href="http://www.aircrack-ng.org/doku.php?id=airbase-ng&amp;DokuWiki=a963867ed97ec90b223f20934eb891e8" title="airbase-ng">airbase-ng</a>, 
          <a class="wikilink1" href="http://www.aircrack-ng.org/doku.php?id=tkiptun-ng&amp;DokuWiki=a963867ed97ec90b223f20934eb891e8" title="tkiptun-ng">tkiptun-ng</a> and 
          <a class="wikilink1" href="http://www.aircrack-ng.org/doku.php?id=airdecloak-ng&amp;DokuWiki=a963867ed97ec90b223f20934eb891e8" title="airdecloak-ng">airdecloak-ng</a>
         </div> 
        </div> </li> 
       <li class="level1">
        <div class="li"> 
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Optimizations, other improvements and bug fixing
         </div> 
        </div> </li> 
       <li class="level1">
        <div class="li"> 
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           …
         </div> 
        </div> </li> 
      </ul> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: center;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: x-large;"><a href="http://aircrack-ng.org/install.html" target="_blank">Download&nbsp;Aircrack-ng 1.2 RC 2</a></span></b>
      </div> 
     </div>
    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="4688643533267726641" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> Aircrack-ng 1.2 RC 3 - WEP and WPA-PSK Keys Cracking Program  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-4688643533267726641" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ZBxtYEUB1E8/VlMm92N73VI/AAAAAAAAE08/AB0J8tlLIlE/s1600/aircrack-ng.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ZBxtYEUB1E8/VlMm92N73VI/AAAAAAAAE08/AB0J8tlLIlE/s1600/aircrack-ng.jpg"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Aircrack-ng is an 802.11 WEP and WPA-PSK keys cracking program that can recover keys once enough data packets have been captured. It implements the standard FMS attack along with some optimizations like KoreK attacks, as well as the PTW attack, thus making the attack much faster compared to other WEP cracking tools.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Third release candidate and hopefully this should be the last one. It contains a ton of bug fixes, code cleanup, improvements and compilation fixes everywhere. Some features were added: AppArmor profiles, better FreeBSD support, including an airmon-ng for FreeBSD.
      </div> 
      <a name="more"></a>
      <br> 
      <h3 style="text-align: justify;"> Aircrack-ng Changelog</h3> 
      <div class="level1"> 
       <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
        <strong>Version 1.2-rc3 (changes from aircrack-ng 1.2-rc2) - Released 21 Nov 2015</strong>: 
       </div> 
       <ul> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Airodump-ng: Prevent sending signal to init which caused the system to reboot/shutdown.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Airbase-ng: Allow to use a user-specified ANonce instead of a randomized one when doing the 4-way handshake
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Aircrack-ng: Fixed compilation warnings.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Aircrack-ng: Removed redundant NULL check and fixed typo in another one.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Aircrack-ng: Workaround for segfault when compiling aircrack-ng with clang and gcrypt and running a check.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Airmon-ng: Created version for FreeBSD.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Airmon-ng: Prevent passing invalid values as channel.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Airmon-ng: Handle udev renaming interfaces.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Airmon-ng: Better handling of rfkill.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Airmon-ng: Updated OUI 
           <abbr title="Uniform Resource Locator">URL</abbr>.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Airmon-ng: Fix VM detection.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">

          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Airmon-ng: Various cleanup and fixes (including wording and typos).
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Airmon-ng: Display iw errors.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Airmon-ng: Improved handling of non-monitor interfaces.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Airmon-ng: Fixed error when running 'check kill'.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Airdrop-ng: Display error instead of stack trace.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Airmon-ng: Fixed bashism.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Airdecap-ng: Allow specifying output file names.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">

          </div>

          </div> 
         </div> </li>

          </div> 
         </div> </li>

          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Manpages: Fixed, updated and improved airodump-ng, airmon-ng, aircrack-ng, airbase-ng and aireplay-ng manpages.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            Aircrack-ng 
           <abbr title="Graphical User Interface">GUI</abbr>: Fixes issues with wordlists selection.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">

          <div style="text-align: justify;">

          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li">

          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li">

          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li">

          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">

          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">

          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">

          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            General: Fixed typos in various tools.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">

          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li">

          </div> 
         </div> </li>

          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li">

          </div> 
         </div> </li>

         <div class="li">

          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            General: Fixed memory leaks, use afer free, null termination and return values in various tools and OSdep.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">
            General: Fixed compilation on FreeBSD.
          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li">

          </div> 
         </div> </li> 
        <li class="level1">
         <div class="li"> 
          <div style="text-align: justify;">

          </div> 
         </div> </li>

       </div>

    <article class="post hentry" id="3118813516421279667" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> AntiCuckoo - A Tool to Detect and Crash Cuckoo Sandbox  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-3118813516421279667" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-88xPXcYhtoo/VZKhiZhO_YI/AAAAAAAAESU/QHV_Iz7LMnw/s1600/anticuckoo.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="318" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-88xPXcYhtoo/VZKhiZhO_YI/AAAAAAAAESU/QHV_Iz7LMnw/s400/anticuckoo.png" width="400"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> A tool to detect and crash Cuckoo Sandbox. Tested in 
      <a href="http://www.cuckoosandbox.org/">Cuckoo Sandbox Official</a> and 
      <a href="https://github.com/brad-accuvant/cuckoo-modified">Accuvant's Cuckoo version</a>.
      <br> 
      <a name="more"></a>
      <br> 
      <b><span style="font-size: large;">Features</span></b>
      <br> 
      <ul> 
       <li><b>Detection: </b>
        <ul> 
         <li>Cuckoo hooks detection (all kind of cuckoo hooks).</li> 
         <li>Suspicius data in own memory (without APIs, page per page scanning).</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li><b>Crash (Execute with arguments)</b> (out of a sandbox these args dont crash the program): 
        <ul> 
         <li>-c1: Modify the RET N instruction of a hooked API with a higher value. Next call to API pushing more args into stack. If the hooked API is called from the Cuckoo's HookHandler the program crash because it only pushes the real API args then the modified RET N instruction corrupt the HookHandler's stack.</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
      </ul> The overkill methods can be useful. For example using the overkill methods you have two features in one: detection/crash and "a kind of Sleep" (Cuckoomon bypass long Sleeps calls).
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <b><span style="font-size: large;">Cuckoo Detection</span></b>
      <br> 
      <br> Submit Release/anticuckoo.exe to analysis in Cuckoo Sandbox. Check the screenshots (console output). Also you can check Accesed Files in Sumary:
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-D6_mK0N7wSQ/VZLGCRGPkYI/AAAAAAAAESk/Q2h6DeFlyjY/s1600/anticuckoo01.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="452" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-D6_mK0N7wSQ/VZLGCRGPkYI/AAAAAAAAESk/Q2h6DeFlyjY/s640/anticuckoo01.png" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> Accesed Files in Sumary (django web):
      <br> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-hJ3eRkdBIzo/VZLGHvL0i8I/AAAAAAAAESs/K2OD8IkALQM/s1600/anticuckoo02.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="442" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-hJ3eRkdBIzo/VZLGHvL0i8I/AAAAAAAAESs/K2OD8IkALQM/s640/anticuckoo02.png" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <b><span style="font-size: large;">Cuckoo Crash</span></b>
      <br> 
      <br> Specify in submit options the crash argument, ex 
      <strong>-c1</strong> (via django web):
      <br> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Nsfx4JbT9SI/VZLGNj-0DcI/AAAAAAAAES0/RLbFK-FVoCc/s1600/anticuckoo03.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="365" src="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Nsfx4JbT9SI/VZLGNj-0DcI/AAAAAAAAES0/RLbFK-FVoCc/s400/anticuckoo03.png" width="400"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> And check 
      <strong>Screenshots/connect via RDP/whatson connection</strong> to verify the crash. Ex 
      <strong>-c1</strong> via RDP:
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-KKR21M5lcOM/VZLGVIU54HI/AAAAAAAAES8/gYbpvFhwkwY/s1600/anticuckoo04.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="336" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-KKR21M5lcOM/VZLGVIU54HI/AAAAAAAAES8/gYbpvFhwkwY/s640/anticuckoo04.png" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: center;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: x-large;"><a href="https://github.com/David-Reguera-Garcia-Dreg/anticuckoo" target="_blank">Download&nbsp;AntiCuckoo</a></span></b>
      </div> 
     </div>
    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="2569948089116540144" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> AppCrashView - View Application Crashes (.wer files)  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-2569948089116540144" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-0hvQGiaaD5U/VNE103qPplI/AAAAAAAADpQ/COZa0ZnplGA/s1600/appcrashview.gif" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-0hvQGiaaD5U/VNE103qPplI/AAAAAAAADpQ/COZa0ZnplGA/s1600/appcrashview.gif" height="397" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        AppCrashView is a small utility for Windows Vista and Windows 7 that displays the details of all application crashes occurred in your system. The crashes information is extracted from the .wer files created by the Windows Error Reporting (WER) component of the operating system every time that a crash is occurred. AppCrashView also allows you to easily save the crashes list to text/csv/html/xml file.
      </div> 
      <a name="more"></a>
      <br> 
      <span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: large; font-weight: bold;">System Requirements</span>
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br> For now, this utility only works on Windows Vista, Windows 7, and Windows Server 2008, simply because the earlier versions of Windows don't save the crash information into .wer files. It's possible that in future versions, I'll also add support for Windows XP/2000/2003 by using Dr. Watson (Drwtsn32.exe) or other debug component that capture the crash information.
       <br> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: large; font-weight: bold;">Using AppCrashView</span>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br> AppCrashView doesn't require any installation process or additional dll files. In order to start using it, simply run the executable file - AppCrashView.exe The main window of AppCrashView contains 2 pane. The upper pane displays the list of all crashes found in your system, while the lower pane displays the content of the crash file that you select in the upper pane. 
       <br> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        You can select one or more crashes in the upper pane, and then save them (Ctrl+S) into text/html/xml/csv file or copy them to the clipboard ,and paste them into Excel or other spreadsheet application.
       <br> 
       <br> 
       <span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: large; font-weight: bold;">Command-Line Options</span>
      </div> 
      <table border="1" bordercolor="#000000" cellpadding="5"> 
       <tbody> 
        <tr>
         <td nowrap>/ProfilesFolder &lt;Folder&gt; </td>
         <td>Specifies the user profiles folder (e.g: c:\users) to load. If this parameter is not specified, the profiles folder of the current operating system is used. </td>
        </tr> 
        <tr>
         <td nowrap>/ReportsFolder &lt;Folder&gt; </td>
         <td>Specifies the folder that contains the WER files you wish to load. </td>
        </tr> 
        <tr>
         <td nowrap>/ShowReportQueue &lt;0 | 1&gt; </td>
         <td>Specifies whether to enable the 'Show ReportQueue Files' option. 1 = enable, 0 = disable </td>
        </tr> 
        <tr>
         <td nowrap>/ShowReportArchive &lt;0 | 1&gt; </td>
         <td>Specifies whether to enable the 'Show ReportArchive Files' option. 1 = enable, 0 = disable </td>
        </tr> 
        <tr>
         <td nowrap>/stext &lt;Filename&gt; </td>
         <td>Save the list of application crashes into a regular text file. </td>
        </tr> 
        <tr>
         <td nowrap>/stab &lt;Filename&gt; </td>
         <td>Save the list of application crashes into a tab-delimited text file. </td>
        </tr> 
        <tr>
         <td nowrap>/scomma &lt;Filename&gt; </td>
         <td>Save the list of application crashes into a comma-delimited text file (csv). </td>
        </tr> 
        <tr>
         <td nowrap>/stabular &lt;Filename&gt; </td>
         <td>Save the list of application crashes into a tabular text file. </td>
        </tr> 
        <tr>
         <td nowrap>/shtml &lt;Filename&gt; </td>
         <td>Save the list of application crashes into HTML file (Horizontal). </td>
        </tr> 
        <tr>
         <td nowrap>/sverhtml &lt;Filename&gt; </td>
         <td>Save the list of application crashes into HTML file (Vertical). </td>
        </tr> 
        <tr>
         <td nowrap>/sxml &lt;Filename&gt; </td>
         <td>Save the list of application crashes into XML file. </td>
        </tr> 
        <tr>
         <td nowrap>/sort &lt;column&gt; </td>
         <td>This command-line option can be used with other save options for sorting by the desired column. If you don't specify this option, the list is sorted according to the last sort that you made from the user interface. The &lt;column&gt; parameter can specify the column index (0 for the first column, 1 for the second column, and so on) or the name of the column, like "Event Name" and "Process File". You can specify the '~' prefix character (e.g: "~Event Time") if you want to sort in descending order. You can put multiple /sort in the command-line if you want to sort by multiple columns. Examples: <br> AppCrashView.exe /shtml "f:\temp\crashlist.html" /sort 2 /sort ~1 <br> AppCrashView.exe /shtml "f:\temp\crashlist.html" /sort "Process File" </td>
        </tr> 
        <tr>
         <td nowrap>/nosort </td>
         <td>When you specify this command-line option, the list will be saved without any sorting. &nbsp; &nbsp;</td>
        </tr> 
       </tbody>
      </table> 
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: center;"> 
       <b><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: x-large;"><a href="http://www.nirsoft.net/utils/app_crash_view.html" target="_blank">Download&nbsp;AppCrashView</a></span></b>
      </div> 
     </div>
    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="4113641356511686155" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> Appie - Android Pentesting Portable Integrated Environment  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-4113641356511686155" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-WQjf50GM_XU/VMf7puE6ZOI/AAAAAAAADnA/pqhu9c6ha6w/s1600/appie.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-WQjf50GM_XU/VMf7puE6ZOI/AAAAAAAADnA/pqhu9c6ha6w/s1600/appie.png" height="302" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Appie is a software package that has been pre-configured to function as an Android Pentesting Environment.It is completely portable and can be carried on USB stick.This is a one stop answer for all the tools needed in Android Application Security Assessment.
      </div> 
      <a name="more"></a>
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <b>Difference between Appie and existing environments ?</b>
      </div> 
      <ul> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Tools contained in Appie are running on host machine instead of running on virtual machine.</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Less Space Needed(Only 600MB compared to atleast 8GB of Virual Machine)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">As the name suggests it is completely Portable i.e it can be carried on <strong>USB Stick or on your own smartphone</strong> and your pentesting environment will go wherever you go without any differences.</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Awesome Interface</li> 
      </ul> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <b>Which tools are included in Appie ?</b>
      </div> 
      <div> 
       <ul> 
        <li style="text-align: justify;"><a href="https://www.mwrinfosecurity.com/products/drozer/">Drozer</a></li> 
        <li style="text-align: justify;"><a href="https://code.google.com/p/dex2jar/">dex2jar</a></li> 
        <li style="text-align: justify;"><a href="https://github.com/androguard/androguard">Androguard</a></li> 
        <li style="text-align: justify;"><a href="https://github.com/iSECPartners/Introspy-Analyzer">Introspy-Analyzer</a></li> 
        <li style="text-align: justify;"><a href="http://jd.benow.ca/">Jd-Gui</a></li> 
        <li style="text-align: justify;"><a href="https://developer.android.com/tools/help/adb.html">Android Debug Bridge</a></li> 
        <li style="text-align: justify;"><a href="https://code.google.com/p/android-apktool/">Apktool</a></li> 
        <li style="text-align: justify;"><a href="http://www.sublimetext.com/">Sublime Text </a></li> 
        <li style="text-align: justify;"><a href="https://code.google.com/p/androguard/#Sublime_Text_2_Plugin">Androguard SublimeText Plugin</a></li> 
        <li style="text-align: justify;"><a href="https://developer.android.com/tools/help/adt.html">Eclipse with Android Developer Tools</a></li> 
        <li style="text-align: justify;"><a href="https://github.com/jackMannino/OWASP-GoatDroid-Project">Owasp GoatDroid Project Configured</a></li> 
        <li style="text-align: justify;">Fastboot and sqlite3</li> 
        <li style="text-align: justify;">Java Runtime Environment and Python Files.With these you don’t even need to have Python or Java Runtime Environment installed on the computer.</li> 
        <li style="text-align: justify;">Nearly all UNIX commands like ls, cat, chmod, cp, find, git, unzip, mkdir, ssh, openssl, keytool ,jarsigner and many others</li> 
       </ul> 
       <div> 
        <br>
       </div> 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: center;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: x-large;"><a href="http://manifestsecurity.com/appie/#Download" target="_blank">Download&nbsp;Appie</a></span></b>
      </div> 
     </div>
    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="5754697579253274780" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> AppUse - Android Pentest Platform Unified Standalone Environment  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-5754697579253274780" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-v70XGEUu4lY/VN0mUk73sdI/AAAAAAAADro/_ReOMgObkEg/s1600/AppUse.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-v70XGEUu4lY/VN0mUk73sdI/AAAAAAAADro/_ReOMgObkEg/s1600/AppUse.png" height="420" width="640"></a>
      </div> AppUse Virtual Machine, developed by AppSec Labs, is a unique (and free) system, a platform for mobile application security testing in the android environment, and it includes unique custom-made tools.
      <br> 
      <a name="more"></a>
      <br> 
      <div class="flex_column av_two_third first  avia-builder-el-10  el_after_av_hr  el_before_av_one_third  "> 
       <b><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: large;">Faster &amp;&nbsp;More&nbsp;Powerful</span></b>
       <br> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        The system is a blessing to security teams, who from now on can easily perform security tests on Android applications. It was created as a virtual machine targeted for penetration testing teams who are interested in a convenient, personalized platform for android application security testing, for catching security problems and analysis of the application traffic.
       <br> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Now, in order to test Android applications, all you will need is to download AppUse Virtual Machine, activate it, load your application and test it.
       <br> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <span class="hr-inner "><span class="hr-inner-style"></span></span> 
      <br> 
      <span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: large;"><b>Easy to&nbsp;Use</b></span>
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        There is no need for installation of simulators and testing tools, no need for SSL certificates of the proxy software, everything comes straight out of the box pre-installed and configured for an ideal user experience.
       <br> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Security experts who have seen the machine were very excited, calling it the next ‘BackTrack’ (a famous system for testing security problems), specifically adjusted for Android application security testing.
       <br> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        AppUse VM closes gaps in the world of security, now there is a special and customized testing environment for Android applications; an environment like this has not been available until today, certainly not with the rich format offered today by AppUse VM.
       <br> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        This machine is intended for the daily use of security testers everywhere for Android applications, and is a must-have tool for any security person.
       <br> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        We at AppSec Labs do not stagnate, specifically at a time in which so many cyber attacks take place, we consider it our duty to assist the public and enable quick and effective security testing.
       <br> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        As a part of AppSec Labs’ policy to promote application security in general, and specifically mobile application security, AppUse is offered as a free download on our website, in order to share the knowledge, experience and investment with the data security community.
       <br> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div class="container"> 
       <b><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: large;">Features</span></b>
      </div> 
      <ul> 
       <li>New Application Data Section</li> 
       <li>&nbsp;Tree-view of the application’s folder/file structure</li> 
       <li>&nbsp;Ability to pull files</li> 
       <li>&nbsp;Ability to view files</li> 
       <li>&nbsp;Ability to edit files</li> 
       <li>&nbsp;Ability to extract databases</li> 
       <li>&nbsp;Dynamic proxy managed via the Dashboard</li> 
       <li>&nbsp;New application-reversing features</li> 
       <li>&nbsp;Updated ReFrameworker tool</li> 
       <li>&nbsp;Dynamic indicator for Android device status</li> 
       <li>&nbsp;Bugs and functionality fixes</li> 
      </ul> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: center;"> 
       <b><span class="Apple-style-span" style="font-size: x-large;"><a href="https://appsec-labs.com/appuse/" target="_blank">Download&nbsp;AppUse</a></span></b>
      </div> 
     </div>
    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="5758337824853893215" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> ARDT - Akamai Reflective DDoS Tool  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-5758337824853893215" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-gWlIkxAM9lw/VjaUVp8dA-I/AAAAAAAAEwc/DqwQLQQpxhw/s1600/ARDT.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="320" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-gWlIkxAM9lw/VjaUVp8dA-I/AAAAAAAAEwc/DqwQLQQpxhw/s640/ARDT.png" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong><span style="font-size: large;"> Akamai Reflective DDoS Tool </span></strong> 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Attack the origin host behind the Akamai Edge hosts and bypass the DDoS protection offered by Akamai services.
      </div> 
      <a name="more"></a>
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong><span style="font-size: large;">How it works...</span></strong>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Based off the research done at NCC: ( 
       <a href="https://dl.packetstormsecurity.net/papers/attack/the_pentesters_guide_to_akamai.pdf" target="_blank"> https://dl.packetstormsecurity.net/papers/attack/the_pentesters_guide_to_akamai.pdf </a> ) 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Akamai boast around 100,000 edge nodes around the world which offer load balancing, web application firewall, caching etc, to ensure that a minimal amount of requests actually hit your origin web-server beign protected. However, the issue with caching is that you cannot cache something that is non-deterministic, I.E a search result. A search that has not been requested before is likely not in the cache, and will result in a Cache-Miss, and the Akamai edge node requesting the resource from the origin server itself. 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        What this tool does is, provided a list of Akamai edge nodes and a valid cache missing request, produces multiple requests that hit the origin server via the Akamai edge nodes. As you can imagine, if you had 50 IP addresses under your control, sending requests at around 20 per second, with 100,000 Akamai edge node list, and a request which resulting in 10KB hitting the origin, if my calculations are correct, thats around 976MB/ps hitting the origin server, which is a hell of a lot of traffic. 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong><span style="font-size: large;"> Finding Akamai Edge Nodes </span></strong> 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        To find Akamai Edge Nodes, the following script has been included:
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <pre><code># python ARDT_Akamai_EdgeNode_Finder.py</code></pre> 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        This can be edited quite easily to find more, it then saves the IPS automatically. 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: center;"> 
       <b> <span style="font-size: x-large;"> <a href="https://github.com/m57/ARDT" target="_blank">Download ARDT </a> </span> </b> 
      </div> 
     </div>
    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="1373570546639654868" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> Ares - Python Botnet and Backdoor  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-1373570546639654868" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-cl-zVEPQGY4/Vm3V_nX7TuI/AAAAAAAAE7c/r0MAYCe6Yj4/s1600/ares_01.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="176" src="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-cl-zVEPQGY4/Vm3V_nX7TuI/AAAAAAAAE7c/r0MAYCe6Yj4/s640/ares_01.PNG" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-_QIFD9t63Jg/Vm3V_2o2qpI/AAAAAAAAE7g/KtwSrU3bNrI/s1600/ares_02.PNG" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="250" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-_QIFD9t63Jg/Vm3V_2o2qpI/AAAAAAAAE7g/KtwSrU3bNrI/s640/ares_02.PNG" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> Ares is made of two main programs:
      <br> 
      <ul> 
       <li>A Command aNd Control server, which is a Web interface to administer the agents</li> 
       <li>An agent program, which is run on the compromised host, and ensures communication with the CNC</li> 
      </ul> The Web interface can be run on any server running Python. You need to install the cherrypy package.
      <br> The client is a Python program meant to be compiled as a win32 executable using 
      <a href="https://github.com/pyinstaller/pyinstaller" title="pyinstaller">pyinstaller</a>. It depends on the 
      <strong>requests</strong>, 
      <strong>pythoncom</strong>, 
      <strong>pyhook</strong> python modules and on 
      <strong>PIL</strong> (Python Imaging Library).
      <br> 
      <a name="more"></a>
      <br> It currently supports:
      <br> 
      <ul> 
       <li>remote cmd.exe shell</li> 
       <li>persistence</li> 
       <li>file upload/download</li> 
       <li>screenshot</li> 
       <li>key logging</li> 
      </ul> 
      <div> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <h2> Installation</h2> 
      <h3> Server</h3> To install the server, first create the sqlite database:
      <br> 
      <strong>cd server/</strong>
      <br> 
      <strong>python db_init.py</strong>
      <br> If no installed, install the 
      <strong>cherrypy</strong> python package.
      <br> Then launch the server by issuing: 
      <strong>python server.py</strong>
      <br> By default, the server listens on http://localhost:8080
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <h3> Agent</h3> The agent can be launched as a python script, but it is ultimately meant to be compiled as a win32 executable using 
      <a href="https://github.com/pyinstaller/pyinstaller" title="pyinstaller">pyinstaller</a>.
      <br> 
      <br> First, install all the dependencies:
      <br> 
      <ul> 
       <li>requests</li> 
       <li>pythoncom</li> 
       <li>pyhook</li> 
       <li>PIL</li> 
      </ul> Then, configure agent/settings.py according to your needs:
      <br> SERVER_URL = URL of the CNC http server
      <br> BOT_ID = the (unique) name of the bot, leave empty to use hostname
      <br> DEBUG = should debug messages be printed to stdout ?
      <br> IDLE_TIME = time of inactivity before going in idle mode (the agent checks the CNC for commands far less often when idle).
      <br> REQUEST_INTERVAL = interval between each query to the CNC when active
      <br> Finally, use pyinstaller to compile the agent into a single exe file:
      <br> 
      <pre><code>cd client/
pyinstaller --onefile --noconsole agent.py</code></pre> 
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: center;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: x-large;"><a href="https://github.com/sweetsoftware/Ares" target="_blank">Download Ares</a></span></b>
      </div> 
     </div>
    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="4822928764321812733" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> AsHttp - Shell Command to Expose any other Command as HTTP  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-4822928764321812733" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-MQCGQFaZG_8/VWnBbpW-mxI/AAAAAAAAEIU/I2_vgQ5XPPU/s1600/ashttp.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="406" src="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-MQCGQFaZG_8/VWnBbpW-mxI/AAAAAAAAEIU/I2_vgQ5XPPU/s640/ashttp.png" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        ashttp provide a simple way to expose any shell command by HTTP. For example, to expose top by HTTP, try : ashttp -p8080 top ; then try http://localhost:8080.
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <b><span style="font-size: large;">Dependencies</span></b>
      <br> 
      <br> ashttp depends on hl_vt100, a headless VT100 emulator.
      <br> To get and compile hl_vt100 :
      <br> 
      <pre><code>$ git clone https://github.com/JulienPalard/vt100-emulator.git
$ aptitude install python-dev
$ make python_module
$ python setup.py install
</code></pre> 
      <a name="more"></a>
      <br> 
      <b><span style="font-size: large;">Usage</span></b>
      <br> 
      <br> ashttp can serve any text application over HTTP, like :
      <br> 
      <pre><code>$ ashttp -p 8080 top
</code></pre> to serve a top on port 8080
      <br> 
      <pre><code>$ ashttp -p 8080 watch -n 1 ls -lah /tmp
</code></pre> 
      <br> to serve an actualized directory listing of /tmp 
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: center;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: x-large;"><a href="https://github.com/JulienPalard/ashttp" target="_blank">Download&nbsp;AsHttp</a></span></b>
      </div> 
     </div>
    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="5531831937954420286" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> ATSCAN - Server, Site and Dork Scanner  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-5531831937954420286" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-jlIdbDPxXtM/Vm3PwnZ_pdI/AAAAAAAAE6k/SqoJ9yS_NwM/s1600/atscan.jpeg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="152" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-jlIdbDPxXtM/Vm3PwnZ_pdI/AAAAAAAAE6k/SqoJ9yS_NwM/s640/atscan.jpeg" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <h3> <b>Description:</b></h3> 
      <ul> 
       <li>ATSCAN Version 2&nbsp;</li> 
       <li>Dork scanner.&nbsp;</li> 
       <li>XSS scanner.&nbsp;</li> 
       <li>Sqlmap.&nbsp;</li> 
       <li>LFI scanner.</li> 
       <li>Filter wordpress and Joomla sites in the server.&nbsp;</li> 
       <li>Find Admin page.</li> 
       <li>Decode / Encode MD5 + Base64.&nbsp;</li> 
      </ul> 
      <br> 
      <h3> <b>Libreries to install: </b></h3> 
      <pre><code>ap-get install libxml-simple-perl</code></pre> NOTE: Works in linux platforms.
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <h3> Permissions &amp; Executution: </h3> 
      <pre><code>$chmod +x atscan.pl 
perl ./atscan.pl</code></pre> 
      <br> 
      <h3> <b>Screenshots:&nbsp;</b></h3> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-_rtfEbNOeRQ/Vm3QWVbDi9I/AAAAAAAAE6s/T_sWazaeHgE/s1600/01.jpeg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="384" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-_rtfEbNOeRQ/Vm3QWVbDi9I/AAAAAAAAE6s/T_sWazaeHgE/s640/01.jpeg" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nClHigHLdzQ/Vm3QWpCYHrI/AAAAAAAAE6w/1mRwoQVMvuo/s1600/02.jpeg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="382" src="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nClHigHLdzQ/Vm3QWpCYHrI/AAAAAAAAE6w/1mRwoQVMvuo/s640/02.jpeg" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;">
